Immediately afterwards I felt so disgusted by this stupid security arrangement (I spent £2.5 for nothing!) I threw away my food in rage as well. (Yes I should have better EQ but you just don't expect this sort of treatment at a major international airport do you?). Once we reached the gate's waiting room we had to queue right away and there were just no seats. Given its global importance I just can't comprehend how Schiphol can fail this miserably and like other negative comments the management should really wake up!

author: L Lem
content: I was born and raised in Amsterdam. I have lived now in the US for 25 years and have traveled back and forth numerous times and always enjoyed it. Last time though it was under construction and indeed a mess. But I am sure it will be even better when they are done. The common discussion on the reviews is the rudeness of the employees at the airport. If you know the Dutch language you know that they are very direct and when translated directly coming from inexperienced speakers it comes across as rude. Even now after many years living in the US I still catch myself being too direct. I have never experienced any rudeness and the employees are always very friendly or at least polite. Looking forward to a new and even better Schiphol.

author: Ravi Mene
content: Recently had a chance to use Schipol as a hub during our visit to Amsterdam. Everything works at this airport the trains planes buses and shuttles. Shopping is very good. There is improvement/refurbishment going on airside to make it even better? The only negative was a very long walk after immigration to reach your gate I like the idea of security check near the boarding area as this reduces the massive bottleneck at the start of your journey. The food joints are plenty and quick. Would use this as hub in future specially from North of England as there are frequent connecting flights.

author: K Lau
content: My arrival was relatively easy but you could have difficulty using the machines to buy train tickets as they rejected all my 3 international credit cards (visa & amex). Departure was a nightmare. No signs for customs and tax refund counters. Very long queue with just few people in the line (I waited over 30 minutes for Global Blue tax refund with just 6 people in front of me). Poor shopping experience with unhelpful and rude staff at the Fashion & Travel shop. And because of the decentralized security check I was stuck at the gate for over an hour with no food drinks or restroom. My last visit was a very pleasant experience seven years ago. I travel to on average 2-3 European major airports on an annual basis. The deterioration in Schiphol was to my dismay.

author: Bob Motto
content: There is a lot of building work taking place at the moment at this airport it is a complete shambles and mess for all passengers. If anyone is wanting to use the business lounges be prepared for a long walk across roof tops open to the elements. The walk to the British Airways lounge takes about 20 mins so please be aware of this for when you need to get to your departure gate as it will take over 40 mins to get to the D gates. The building work will be going on for a number of months so be prepared for a lot of walking & incorrect signage. If you are looking for places to eat these are few and far between as most have been closed and removed due to the building work.

author: Frank Matsaert
content: I found this airport poorly run. First there is nobody manning half the transfer desks (e.g. At T9) second my flight was cancelled and they put me in an airport hotel that was actually 20km from the airport they gave incorrect information and finally the security staff are the most rude I've come abroad in 20 years. Avoid this so called efficient airport at all costs it's badly run!

author: M Taylor
content: Big airport with good [but as usual expensive] rail connection to Amsterdam proper and relatively cheap premium local beer airside departures. The annoying thing is the security-at-the-gate which always annoys me but otherwise I think this airport is reasonable for it's size and location. As others have noted there is some walking required - but I don't understand people's insistence that when travelling 10000km they should not have to walk a single pace without some kind of mechanical assistance. I don't mind walking it's usually faster than the moving walkways with groups and couples standing willy-nilly in the middle on the left and on the right all at the same time while enjoying the skin-crawlingly-slow pace of crawling forwards towards their destination.

author: J Atravel
content: A thoroughly shoddy experience. Very long walk to connecting flight with travelators not working. Then officious staff trying without success to place cabin baggage in the hold. But the biggest disappointment of all was the fact that there was nowhere to site in the departure gate because the airport is so far behind the development of larger long-haul aircraft. So more people than seats - and no opportunity to sit and relax before the flight.

author: P Kniebusch
content: It is surprising how an airport can change during renovations. It is one large building site at the moment between terminal E and F. Therefore it means that passengers have to walk long ways where in the past they had conveyor belts. But I am sure that it will change again after they have finished. For the time of renovations we have to live with these problems. On the Schengen site I loved the roof garden. It is a perfect place to enjoy.

author: Nick Lester-Davis
content: Definitely going downhill as an airport. A long walk with no assistance from the railway station to the passport control followed by another very long walk - about 15 minutes - to the airport lounge which included climbing a flight of stairs and a 5 minute walk along a rough shelter on the rooftop. Then the same in reverse as part of another 15 minute walk (with one travelator for a short section) to get to the gate. This was not helped by the airport deciding to test the fire shutters in the middle of the afternoon which made everyone wait for 15 minutes while they came down were tested and then went up again. This airport is now just too big.

author: W McKenzie
content: This used to be my favourite airport but the security arrangements for non Schengen departures (security at the gate) have actually made Heathrow look a more attractive option - and that's something I never thought I'd write. Complete chaos from beginning to end. Locked gate nowhere it sit massive queue no room to prepare for check no room to reassemble myself after check then called for boarding to be shuffled through to a smaller area where everyone stands (because there are only 8 seats) for 20 minutes awaiting permission to board. Appreciate the terminal is undergoing renovations but I don't think those have anything to do with the dog's breakfast of security that those traveling to non schengen destinations have to endure. And to make it worse I was transiting having already undergone security at my initial point of departure.

author: S Lubis
content: First time transiting in Amsterdam after many years the Airport is undergoing massive renovation and it really is inconvenient. Have 4 hours to kill but not too many food options available and we ended up in McDonald's as this seems the most familiar choice. As an Asian would prefer to have Asian food available at the Airport but there seems no choice for this except for a sushi place which is very crowded at that time. The place looks like a mess due to the renovation and we have to walk quite far via a narrow and dark corridor to a more decent area for transit (the Holland Boulevard) to do some last minute duty free shopping. Hopefully the renovation will make Schiphol one of the world's best again. One of the good thing about the Airport is the availability on toilet inside the gate holding room which is very convenient before you board the plane.

author: A Leinenkugel
content: I have traveled all over the world and this was by far the most tiring experience. This was my first experience at Schiphol and I do not recommend it I will be utilizing other international hubs in Europe even if it costs me more money to do so. I was transferring to another plane in Schiphol and while a 2 hour transfer window at any other airport would have warranted time to eat and have a drink it was barely enough time to get on the plane. As such while the facilities looked decent I cannot comment on the food and drinks. I am not sure how this airport is rated so highly but as many others have stated Schiphol is horrible because of the following: Passport Check lines chaotic and slow for non-EU passports (40 minutes). Security personnel are rude (would not be as big of a deal if you didn't have to deal with them so often). Check-in at the gate is 1.5 hours before flight because of the ridiculous decentralized security process. Once again this is a transfer not the initial security check at your first airport. Security interview at gate - seriously this is a first for me and everyone must go through it and is absolutely a waste of time (1 hour with a short line in front of me). Removal of everything in my carry-on - as a traveling consultant I have 2 laptops a tablet a phone and all the necessary chargers headphones and adapters which means everything comes out into clear plastic bags. Yep I needed 3 of them. Luckily I avoided having to wait in the purgatory room after security and prior to boarding as I was one of the last people on the plane. My hard shell checked luggage was cracked open the entire length of the bag. This may have not been the airport's fault but I'll chalk that up to KLM. Schiphol is now my number one airport that I avoid.

author: Ian Sinclair
content: Traveled from Schiphol airport on 16 Feb despite its great PR machine working overtime to convince us that it is a flagship operation this week it resembled a rather shambolic building site. The renovations are of a significant size causing passengers to walk extremely long distances to reach airline lounges. Why couldn't KLM position a lounge closer to the D/E gates? (Or is this yet another way of saving money by assuming that a significant number of passengers will not bother or have the time to hike halfway across the airport to find the downsized facilities?). I am planning to avoid Schiphol until this project is completed it really is a miserable experience.

author: Mark Ellwood
content: Really great Airport to transit Some long walks from different piers but nothing any problem. Loads of places to eat and fabulous choices of food. Amazing shops with everything you could want great for Diamonds and high end watches. Really would recommend anyone thinking about a European airport transit point. Some staff at gate areas rude but that's just human nature.

author: R Jones
content: It been years since I last used Schiphol. It runs quite smoothly and waiting times are minimal. However the lack of clear signage - even for a seasoned traveller is a concern. I had no idea which way to go for the exit but followed the general masses of people heading that way. Departure area D has two signs pointing in opposite directions. Signage in the rail station is even worse so again follow the general crowd arriving.

author: L Michele
content: Horrible. Security is at the gate. They make you take out everything electronic (even my flat iron had to come out). I was just in layover here transferring to another country. The "pre check" they make you go through is ridiculous. They question you about where you've been and where you're going. Keep in mind this was not immigration or customs! Just the gate attendants before you catch your flight. Everyone rude. Will never get a connecting flight through this airport again. After you go through the questioning and the security they then huddle everyone into the tiniest waiting rooms ever to wait to board the flight. Most people didn't have seats. They really need to come up with better systems for pretty much everything here.

author: R Dijkstra
content: An airport that ranks consistently amongst the best. The co-operation between the airport and the home carrier KLM is flawless. Checked in online and without Luggage to check in I walked from the train station straight to immigration cleared within 2 minutes and was on my way to the gate. Yes Amsterdam Schiphol is a large airport but moving walkways are available at each pier. I arrived at the gate and found a seat and used the one-hour free Wifi Internet. This came with a reasonable speed. On arrival back at AMS a few days later it was again quite a large distance to immigration and baggage claim. Immigration is amongst the best in Europe friendly fast and efficient. Luggage took about 15 minutes but after that it was straight to the station underneath the main hall. Excellent large airport in every respect. If only others in Europe and the US would take the time to learn from them.

author: T Smith
content: I flew in on KLM from Canada. Arrival was good. There were short queues for customs. Baggage arrived in reasonable time. My departure was another story. Security clearance was done at the gate. As a result you have to be at the gate an hour and a half before departure. The aircraft was a 747 - very long queues. Once through the we were herded into a small waiting area. There were not enough seats. Passengers were standing shoulder to shoulder. A delay was announced. We were told to remain seated. As only about ten percent had a seat this produced ironic laughter. There was one washroom in the entire area. No water fountain or drinking water. We stood for forty five minutes. I would happily arrive at Schipol. I will avoid departures from there.

author: Gabor Vincze
content: Rude security personnel dirty airport takes lot of time to reach the gates several gate changes without proper communication.

author: A Corsoni
content: Passed through Shiphol Airport several times lately its a big airport and it offers several shops and possibilities to fill a couple hours between flights. Immigration has been fast compared to other airports but I noticed that it took a bit more time for those holding non EU passports. However Immigration personnel (and I mean just immigration) was pleasant and welcoming. All that is quickly forgotten when time comes to deal with the rest of the airport staff: in stores they are rather unwelcoming but the worst comes with the Security checks staff which are the worst i ever seen (and I travel back and forth from North America to Europe and Asia). Security staff at Shiphol Airport are definitely rude to outright offensive towards passengers which most of the times are either too tired/worried to protest. The fact that they aren't that efficient just add frustration to the already bad experience.

author: C Booth
content: Airport seems to be in disorganised mood? Flew from there on Monday and due to works? There was a limited number of eateries available. We reluctantly ate at a Delft themed cafe which was awful. What is going on here?

author: Jack Rowell
content: Compared with other big European airports there is not much going on. Very unimpressive selection of places to eat/drink - suggest you bring your own food and beverages rather than buy theirs.

author: J Flynn
content: Passed through/transferred twice this week. Ridiculous walking distance for the less fit in our group. Once again experienced the aggression of the Dutch traveller - happy to bump into you and 'educating' airport users re walking on the right side. Lack of services especially for eating - and signage very poor. Going through security they're pushing you for no good reason - except maybe as little power trip. The flight was late (probably airline's fault) half the passengers could not hear the local announcements there were 4 staff members at the desk 1 working and the others looking bored. Overall a tiring experience - and compared so badly with Helsinki Airport which is brilliantly laid out chilled and courteous.

author: R Scholten
content: Absolutely the airport I prefer. Mostly I originate from this airport but I have used it also 2 times for connections (transfer). This airport is very efficient and has excellent facilities. There are plenty of shops and restaurants. Staff are friendly and toilets are very clean.

author: P Tierney
content: Chaotic rude security rude staff throughout airport. Very expensive. Transit anywhere but in that horrible place and the Dutch staff are very dogmatic dictatorial and plain unfriendly.

author: Tom Verduin
content: We flew from our national airport to Istanbul Atatürk on Turkish Airlines. We checked in online. That was an excellent choice since the waiting queue for Turkish's check-in desks (only 3 open) was the longest I've seen at Schiphol (about 300m). We dropped our bags at the business class counter. This all went really fast. The queue for passport control however was very long. Only one desk was open. We dropped our bags 2 hours prior departure but after passport control we just had time for a quick cup off coffee before the final boarding call so we rushed to the gate which was a 20 minute walk. When we arrived at the gate boarding hadn't even started however the screens already said 'gate closed'. The boarding queue was just as long as the passport control line and it took us 35 minutes to reach the jetway. We had to clear security and just another passport control before entering the plane. Again only one (of two) lines were in operation. We left the gate 10 min. late and we were in a long queue for takeoff (approx. 9 planes) for runway 09. We took off exactly an hour late but nonetheless arrived 2 minutes early at Atatürk where an even more unpleasant experience awaited us.

author: Padmakumar Ramachandra Rao
content: The best in the world. Clean clear instructions and tons of facilities prompt service train connection and ticket service from inside the airport no hidden charges and most importantly missing in many airports a cash machine!

author: Kevin Tunnicliffe
content: Check in kiosks worked well and there were plenty of them. Only problem was that as well as our own boarding passes it gave us someone else's as well. It just churned it out after ours. Queues for the automated bag drop machines were horrendous and would have been cut by maybe 75% if there had been more than one staff member allocated to help those who had not done this before. Weird system of going through security at the gate meant that people were having to abandon soft drinks they had purchased after clearing passport control and because the process of doing security at the gate is obviously time consuming people were at the gate with no access to drinks or toilets for up to an hour before they were boarded onto the aircraft and there were too few seats for the amount of passengers.

author: Dmitry Kuzin
content: I didn't like anything about my layover in AMS. Moreover the terminals were under construction. At night it was chilly there because of A/Cs working all the way. Crowded everywhere. Cars carrying disabled and seniors go very fast and almost run over people walking on foot making them step aside all the time. Not many seating areas. Duty free shops are ok. Security checks should be passed right by the boarding gate. Staff do not seem to be efficient. Add weird navigation to that and you will get a bad airport for a long stop-over.

author: M Johnson
content: How crazy is it to have security checks at the boarding gates. Things are crazy enough when 300 plus people are lining up to board. And talk about rude security people. Coming in from Manchester and connecting to Portland OR we had to pass security again at the boarding gate. We put our things on the x-ray conveyor and proceeded to the whole body scanner. When I exited the scanner I was met by a young man who begins by saying "Did you not hear my colleague tell you to empty your pockets." And from then on he was sarcastic and demeaning about my ability to follow "orders." I admit that I had items in my pockets (wallet passport pen and my mobile). In all the chaos of the boarding gate I had neglected to remove them for the scanner. If I had had the time I would have sought out his supervisor. Schiphol Airport has advanced to the top of my list of airports to avoid at all costs.

author: G Ducrettet
content: I had to pass through Schiphol yesterday evening I would like to reiterate the nightmare organisation of this airport firstly I came from Edinburgh and on the TV it marked gate M for my next flight to Geneva no signs anywhere marked M I asked 3 officials before they explained I have to go out of the arrivals after a 20 min walk then re enter turn right still no M marked. Finally I saw an M when I entered the departures this is the first airport who doesn't seem to want to make things clear for transfers. At gate M after turning my head for a minute to buy some water the Geneva flight disappeared no explanation nothing we had to ask the security what had happened he had to check on his Iphone and said there was probably a gate change we had to exit the gate and walk for another 20 mins and I walk fast to D my bag had passed with no problem the security at M however this time at D gate they stopped my bag and made me leave some things I had bought (which had also passed the security in Edinburgh also). A rude security officer wouldn't listen to the fact that we had come from another gate and seemed indifferent to our requests. Why was it necessary for us to come out of security and re enter most airports you enter and that's it even if gate changes. I would advise people to transfer through another airport if possible Edinburgh is very nice and well organised.

author: Edward Michaels
content: Chaotic security many staff are just plain rude and this is a dismal airport to transfer through. The walking distances are ridiculous. My transfer airside from G gates to a D gate highlights the poor standards here at Schiphol and then the usual 15 mins trek to find a distant runway that seems like it's in Belgium. This is definitely an airport to avoid if you can. Dirty overcrowded facilities and just generally unpleasant.

author: Hans van den Brink
content: I am amazed this airport often gets high ratings. Shops are alright but much too expensive. Immigration is red tape at the top. Baggage handling for incoming passengers is a horror movie come true. This is an airport to be avoided.

author: C Weere
content: Schipol terminal 3. Gate H constructed of corrugated steel most effective in letting in the heat. No sign of air conditioning - stay away if you can help it. Immigration quick so are security checks friendly too unlike the dead faced staff at Gatwick. Three Euro for 1/2L of water at the airport 25 cents worth from the Supermarket.

author: Hans R T Hansson
content: Easy to find your way having all amenities you need.

author: David Graham
content: I am aware that many reviewers are high in their praise for this airport but I find it so big and the so-called single terminal layout so cumbersome that I often dread having to fly to and from Schiphol. On a recent flight from London-City airport we landed on the‘remote’runway so had to endure a 10-15 minute taxi to the gate. Once we got there the gate was stilled occupied so has to wait for another allocation (typical for this airport). Once we pulled up to the new gate we had as usual to wait for what seemed like ages for the jetty to dock with the aircraft then the endless walking and travelators to immigration added another 10 minutes to the journey. Luckily the immigration was very fast. So given a 40 minute flight from London we spent at least 35 minutes taxiing disembarking and endless walking. I don't find this airport at all suitable for shorter commuter type flights. It may be great for international transfers but for a quick trip from the UK to work in Amsterdam it adds significantly to time and stress.

author: B Pico
content: On March 15 connecting in AMS from GVA to UIO. Chaos happened at Immigration: no lines exist only one airport agent was there but could do nothing to create lines no explanations given. Amazed that an airport as Schipol was unable to organize the situation in which hundred of connecting passengers were left to try to board their flights with that big chaos by their own. This created that my outbound flight was delayed almost an hour. Luckily KL decide to delay the flight to wait for passengers. Not good customer service at AMS Airport: no information given no lines at Immigration not organized free Wi-Fi doesn't work. Is this really one of the best airports in the world?

author: Alexander Mokretsov
content: Excellent airport. Very efficient transit lots of space for sitting and relaxing great self-service check-in zones. Wonderful bars and cafes with good food and drinks. Very comfortable Internet access zone. Absolutely excellent shopping experience. Probably the best European airport I have been to so far.

author: H Oberbeckman
content: Had a really good experience at AMS. On transfer from a transatlantic flight to a short feeder flight in Europe we experienced very short queuing times. There are a lot of power outlets within the waiting areas and free wifi in a lot of areas. Shops and restaurants are also available. The Terminal was clean and due to the size of the airport it's not necessary to walk far between gates.

author: Eric McPherson
content: Often depend on a transit airport for my onward flights from the UK to elsewhere in the world) which means we really only have 4 choices from my home airport Manchester which are Heathrow Paris Frankfurt or Amsterdam. Lately we started using Amsterdam simply as it is the best of all the 4 main hubs in Europe and we really enjoy spending some time there. Frankfurt doesn't inspire Paris CDG is a rubbish place to spend some time just a soulless place (unless you have lounge access I guess which we don't have) and we tend to no longer fly BA as it's just to expensive to the destinations we regularly fly to. That leaves Amsterdam and we tried it a few times now and really like it. There's just so much to see and do the range of shops eateries and places to relax are awesome and every pier has something else to offer there's even a museum and if you have the chance to go through customs to go to the railway station you're greeted by a rather large shopping mall as well. Some airport staff recommended we went through customs to go to the roof terrace where we found to our surprise that an airport was parked on the roof for the public to see really cool. I do agree to some comments that security staff at the gate need to learn some manners as some of them are just awful. I guess that's down to translation issues but the Dutch clearly have to learn to add the word 'please' to their vocabulary it just makes all the difference. Airport staff needs to give security staff some proper training as some have very limited English and as a result sound very rude. Overall KLM airline staff are always pleasant to deal with they really stand out from other airlines it is really noticeable. But back to the airport by far the best airport to kill some time in Europe if you depend on a transit airport. Explore it walk around a bit and you come across lots of great places restaurants and bars also on the upper level.

author: P Cullen
content: I generally like Schiphol it is large and busy but well laid out and has plenty of facilities and never feels particularly crowded. I have generally found queues short and staff helpful. However my most recent experience was rather less than perfect because KLM has introduced some very short transit times. Going out was 55 minutes and on return 40 minutes. The first was just doable but the second very stressful and I only made my flight by jumping a queue (on instruction from staff) and running the last part (I was not alone). The problem is exacerbated if you are on short-haul Cityhopper flights which park away from the terminal and require a bus to and from them this reduces the transit time by at least 10 minutes. On the second occasion my second flight was 'now boarding' as I got off the bus from the first flight and 'gate closing' appeared when I was still some minutes from having my boarding card checked and going through security. This was despite going straight to the gate at a brisk walk anyone unfamiliar with the airport or unable to keep up a good pace would really struggle. In the end Schiphol worked but I found the experience unnerving and I caution transit passengers with less than hour between flights to be ready for a stressful experience.

author: Andrew Wilson
content: There is everything one could want and more in Schiphol. Airside there are hotels a museum casino restaurants good selection of shops smoking rooms and more bars than you could shake a fist at. My favourite airport to spend any length of time in.

author: S Smith
content: Used to be a better place to fly but security is very unprofessional as many other reviewers stated. I don't have issues with the airport itself. Clean decent options for eating (although quite expensive) nice restrooms nice areas to relax and work. On the flip side get ready to be harassed. There is now a full-body scanner at each gate so you are expected to be at your gate an hour and a half early versus the customary 45 minutes at normal airports and even after the full-body scan at the gate you may be subjected to the pat down. For all the things this airport has going it is definitely the worst when it comes to unprofessional and rude security personnel.

author: Yevheniy Kahanovych
content: I used AMS for arrival departure and transfer from non-EU to EU and vice versa. I was impressed with the overall organization (partly thanks to KLM) very reasonable immigration queues very fast security processing baggage transfer. Another important thing was plentiful and clean toilets. Signage was also a pig plus: clear and often. The building despite being huge Is nice and well kept. Boarding process was also ok. Security search was way too thorough but this is for our own sake. The only two disappointments were railway ticket machines that refuse to accept foreign credit cards (not the airport's fault) and rip off drink prices. Since liquids are not allowed through security prepare to pay 2.6 euro for 0.3l bottle of Evian. Shopping didn't impress me either. Overall great for flight. This is what it is needed for.

author: Diarmuid Curran
content: January 5 2014 3 years since I last used Schipol. Their staff were exceptional. It would be easy to criticise when things go wrong as they did before. But when the entire process was so efficient so smooth and seemed tailored to getting the job done one knows its working even though one is not so sure. The staff knew there were problems and went 200% of the way to remedying them. 30/31 December 2010. Due to adverse weather conditions my flight was delayed and if it could go wrong it seemed to go wrong. After all it was a severe winter in Europe DUB-AMS was delayed and I missed my connection to Kuala Lumpur. The right hand did not seem to know what the left was doing. To be honest I'd say I was unlucky in terms of how 'tight' my connections were and my own advice would be to allow 2 hours minimum in any Airport to allow for contingencies. It was the same in September and January 2010 and since then I switched my patronage to Etihad. I'm impressed. KLM and Schipol are now back in my good books.

author: T Whittington
content: One of the best airports in the world and comparable to Asian benchmarks such as HKG. Most recent time I used the airport two days ago I was late and arrived at the airport 2pm by train and made it at C04 at boarding 2.15pm. Security was very fast think they even upscaled a bit for the expected traffic due to Christmas. Unfortunately there was no time left to grab a bite or do some Christmas shopping but airport has sufficient places for that. In the past I have experienced once or twice (in my case <5% of times traveled through the airport) 45 minute wait for the luggage which was too long don't know what happened there the other occasion customs took too long but apparently it was a sudden peak and it took some time to call some extra staff. These two occasions however are not representing the overall performance. The walking distance are normally fine you can be unlucky when you have a stopover and need to go from H peer to B that will take a good twenty minutes. But that shouldn't be a problem for the average healthy person. Still better than a train or worse shuttle bus. So looking at the numerous experiences I had at Schiphol great airport.

author: F Alesch
content: Very bad experience customer unfriendly awful security check. Maybe good for shopping addicts but not for serious flyers.

author: Armando Urrio
content: Queues are really too long and security checks are very suspicious. It takes hours to cross the airport. Luckily it is clean and staff are quite nice.

author: J Wix
content: I found the Schengen to non Schengen transfer in both directions had long queues at passport control I needed the 45/50 minute transfer time. On the way from UK I was given my Schipol gate by helpful staff but not at Madrid or on the plane. People had to push to the front to get their transfers (very politely). People got agitated at D gate though and one very rude English woman impatiently asked me for a gate number (at 64 with a suitcase and rucksack - do you think I looked like an airport official).

author: S Majid
content: Chaotic. Confusing layout. Perhaps in the same league as Heathrow Airport. Definitely way below Changi or Zurich airport. My take is that Schiphol may have reached its handling capacity. It this is not true then blame it on the security check and passport control. These are the ones that are causing pain to the passengers. Will definitely avoid this airport in future trips. Prefer to use Zurich as entry point into Europe.

author: Willem Jansen
content: Good airport lost of destinations clean. However taxi's are the worst you can get in Europe. Avoid these and take public transport or ask friends to pick you up.

author: Pieter Boone
content: Although this airport is far above average I have been annoyed by a few disturbing 'patterns'. My last few arriving flights could not be accommodated at a gate right away because 'the ground staff had not arrived yet'. Even though the delay was less than 10 minutes I find this very strange none of the flights were early and taxi times after landing are extremely long (15 minutes or more) so I gather this should be enough notice. It also seems that connecting a jet bridge at Schiphol takes way longer than any other airport and ground staff seem to struggle moving the jet bridge having to make a few tries before doing it right. Schiphol is a large airport and the fact that 'moving walkways' leading back to the terminal almost always are out of use is just unacceptable. What is the problem? Signs say they are out of use for 'maintenance' but I never see anyone working on them.

author: C Kupper
content: Probably the best airport in the world! All processes link everything is smooth. Staff are very friendly.

author: D Engl
content: Did a few passes through the Airport either starting my journey there or just connecting. KLM check in is anything other than customer friendly. The self baggage check in takes so much time almost everybody needs assistance. If they would use these employees (counted 5) at normal check in it would speed up the whole process and it would be more personal. The security check is by far the most awful I have seen most unprofessional unfriendly people working there. Hope your Gate is not one of the far out on the concourse otherwise you will miss your flight. My advice avoid Amsterdam Schipol if possible.

author: C Graham
content: I like flying KLM however I find Schiphol such a poor airport compared to others in Europe. The shopping is poor with generic duty free shops found in any airport across the world. Very few specific shops. However the thing I dislike the most is that each gate has its own security meaning you can't buy a bottle of water after security to take on the plane. I drink a lot of water and find it helpful to take a bottle on the plane and at several airports I use you clear security and then are able to shop around and buy water however with security being right at the gate it is impossible.

author: E Lang
content: I don't like Schiphol airport. Every time we have a layover its a pain. We check in at the starting airport go through check-in security are all that rubbish until we board the plane (usually KLM) that takes us to Schiphol. When we are there we have to go again through security and check-in and twice did they take things away from us. Apart from that you have to queue everywhere and there is no space for queuing. I will avoid Schiphol when ever possible.

author: Judith Wotherspoon
content: I last visited this airport in 2006 and chose to come back this year. It is efficient and well sign-posted and I like the train being so easily accessible although this time it was luck which got me to the right platform to catch the train to the centre of Amsterdam. Signage and ticket purchase were not as straightforward as I expected. Baggage pick up was slow from my flight and there was a jam of people waiting for the exit gates etc. I still like it and will come again.

author: S Taylor
content: I am frustrated every time I use this airport because of the chaotic line ups when departing. There is often a very long disorganized line up for passport control and the security control is at the gate for international flights. I spend 30 minutes getting through and then you end up in a small waiting room with no chance to buy any liquids for the flight. This time I got a seat but many of the people after me had to stand another 20 minutes before boarding the plane.

author: Patrick Tan
content: This is probably the best airport I have used so far in Europe. Flew in from Barcelona into Schiphol and Schiphol to Dublin. It is probably the most convenient airport with their self check-in kiosks and self drop baggage counters. The airport does look a little old now but still very well-maintained. The only thing that I think can be improved is the immigration counters and queuing areas. Unlike other European airports all airport workers here were very professional. Overall very satisfied with this airport and will definitely choose Schiphol as the gateway into Europe in future.

author: J Nissinen
content: A very easy to use airport. The only minus point would be the often long and chaotic lines at the immigration both sides. The lines for people with EU passports should be respected and reserved for the EU passport only. Lounges are very clean and the food is fresh and tasty. Staff is general extremely professional and helpful. Shopping is excellent. Gates are easy to find.

author: Bob Kimmings
content: This is one huge terminal instead of the usual scattered smaller ones. You can walk a long way if you choose the wrong direction but it is very well sign-posted clean and very efficient. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. I enjoyed the food and the Panorama Terrace.

author: L Osman
content: First time using Schiphol and was a bit disappointed. Found it a bit like an airport from the 70s it is sufficient and massive and has everything but needs a face lift renovating operation. I couldn't understand why arrivals and departures are in the same place it was a bit confusing. I spent some time at the duty free upon arrival so didn't have any queues at passport control. Very well connected with train station buses and all public transport. On departure I checked in online for my Emirates flight however I spent sometime at passport control which was long and slow with only 4 counters. Duty free staff were very friendly and helpful toilets were in very bad condition. The screening and security was too long due to the fact it is a massive A380 aircraft with 500 passengers luckily I was seated in the second row at the front of the aircraft so I took my time and boarded last. All in all a pleasant sufficient airport and will use it again.

author: Chris Lewis
content: I used to like flying through Schiphol but I've completely gone off the place. Best part of an hour to get through immigration on arrival flying back from there you can't go through security screening and then relax with a drink or meal because you're on tenterhooks all the time waiting to be called forward for screening from the lounge area. When you finally do struggle through screening there are very few facilities; what you do have is a long walk and shuffling forward in a queue on a flight of stairs to board your plane. Even Heathrow is a more comfortable experience these days.

author: H Gibbs
content: If Airports were judged solely by the cleanliness of the toilets them Amsterdam Schiphol would come out best. They are spotless. Often there are very long queues for passport control when entering NL from outside a Schengen area. Schiphol is getting very big and one has to look carefully for the way out signs and signs to baggage reclaim due to adverts everywhere.

author: Ian Loftus
content: AMS is generally a pretty good airport but the dreadful system of herding passengers into small gate lounges on F pier is annoying. Why can't security screening be done just before/after immigration and then there will be no need for the gate lounges (shouldn't the whole airside be "sterile" anyway?). Passengers would then actually be able to use toilets have a coffee go shopping etc for longer rather than being locked up.

author: Rob Smit
content: A pleasant and efficient airport for both short and long haul as well as flying with budget airlines. Immigration queues are short or non-existent. Security check usually have a bit longer queues but even then the line keeps moving quickly. Plenty of shops and restaurants on both air side and land side. A great airport.

author: N Barnsley
content: A clean well planned and user-friendly airport with efficient and courteous staff minimal queues at security and short waits at baggage reclaim. Only let down on a recent trip was the poor business class lounge used by KLM for their inter Schengen flights.

author: Mark Kemper
content: This airport is a decent place to make a connection. I have only used it 2 or 3 times as a terminal or originating airport but I have used it 2 or 3 dozen times for connections. The negative is that it can take a very long time to get from one gate to another which can be very difficult if you have a short connection. However if your time is sufficient it is a good airport with good facilities. The KLM Lounge is fabulous after its most recent upgrade. But the general facilities are also good as there are several shopping and food options available to occupy your time. The coffee shops are especially good. This airport is configured such that security checks are performed at each gate on a flight-by-flight basis. The process is reasonably efficient. The immigration checks can get backed up but things usually move at a reasonable pace and the staff are polite and fairly efficient. Signage in the airport is relatively good and flight boards are not too difficult to find. The personnel at the transfer desks are relatively helpful if information is required. There are areas to lounge comfortably on the second level if you have a longer period of time. In all this is a very convenient airport for transit.

author: Mike Jacques
content: My first time through this airport as a transit passenger. Well sign-posted but does not have a friendly feel about it. Food and drink expensive. I would use the airport again to avoid Dubai when flying to Australia/Far East.

author: D Bokr
content: I like travelling through AMS. I find the spacious airport well stocked with restaurants bars shops etc. Most of the staff are friendly and cheery. Most of the immigration officers are grumpy. I have never encountered a long line at immigration or security.

author: P Cullen
content: Transited from non-Schengen to Schengen area flight with little difficulty about a 10 minute wait to have my passport checked and maybe 3 minutes at security. The facilities are excellent plenty of seating with views over the airport and many different food outlets and shops (though they are not cheap). I had a quite complicated question about my return journey (which was not through Schiphol) and the staff were very helpful and efficient in finding the answer. A good experience.

author: Jen Brown
content: Had a transfer here on my way to and from Africa from NYC this month. Overall the airport is new clean and has a variety of shops and dining options. Dining options are a bit expensive. I can't say anything about the passport control as I was only passing through and didn't have to deal with that but the individual security lines at each gate seem inefficient. I had to wait 45 minutes to board the plane because there are only 2 x- ray machines even for the huge 747 I was on. The other issue with having it at the gate is that you aren't allowed to bring any liquids including duty free alcohol or a bottle of water to drink on the plane. An 8 hour flight is pretty dehydrating. I think this may be a US rule only so check before you try to buy anything to bring anything onto the plane.

author: Giacomo Gramazio
content: I travelled to/from Schiphol twice in the last few months and it's an excellent airport. Baggage delivery was fast and indications were clear. Transportation to/from the city is straight and bus line 197 takes only half an hour to get to the centre at a reasonable cost (€4 one way). When departing I used KLM's self check-in and baggage drop off facilities which are very user friendly. Short queues for the security checks. The facilities airside are the best I've seen in Europe and there is a good selection of shops and restaurant. Pity that the prices are a bit too high. All in all an excellent airport that I may decide to use in the future for intercontinental flights too.

author: J Martin
content: This has got to be the worst airport for disabled persons and customer service skills. A disabled passenger should have a wheelchair waiting outside the plane which has been a common sight at other international airports but Amsterdam airport was the worst making the passenger walk to the entryway of the airport and then onto a trolley. No wheelchair access whatsoever! On top of this the customer service skills of the representative were nil. She was outright rude pushing my hand aside as I pointed forward to ask if the gate was up ahead. Who do you complain to when the airport lacks common sense anyway? If you are looking for assistance for a disabled person then I would suggest avoiding this airport altogether.

author: P Apling
content: Poor communication and a lack of departure information monitors. For an ultra modern airport I was very surprised to see such steep and dangerous steps leading down to boarding gates which are extremely unsuitable for young children and elderly passengers. Grand Cafe Plaza possibly the worst cooked breakfast. For two breakfasts a tea a coffee and a bottle of still water we were charged an extortionate €34.95 for a meal which was extremely sub-standard. Next stop the Internet cafe. €3 gets you 15 minutes of nothing as I tried two different keyboards with faulty keys. Absolutely no departure information regarding our EasyJet flight back to London Gatwick. I had to go to an information desk instead. We were told to go to lounge H a 20 minutes walk from the main lounge. Having passed through passport control and a full body X-ray we were greeted by three airport workers conducting a questionnaire. We were not given the option of volunteering we were hijacked into it and I have to say that the questions were absolutely ridiculous. They could see that I was in a hurry and they were not interested in the lack of departure information or the steep and dangerous steps. I cannot say that I would want to visit this airport again. It's huge with plenty of faults.

author: Kai Schlender
content: AMS is one of Europe's main hubs but unlike confusing FRA or crowded LHR quite well-arranged and clean. Although big the terminal is one coherent building and good signposted so no annoying terminal change. For me it's been the best transfer airport I've ever been by now. No long queues at security. Very friendly staff. Cafes/restaurants can be a bit crowded at peak times. Good accessibility by train with own station (local cross-country and international services).

author: I Milono
content: Schiphol is among the best airport in Europe and it surely deserves it. It's huge modern busy and there are plenty of shops. However the plus side of this airport could also be the minus at times especially if you are in hurry catching a flight. It's huge and if you arrive less than 30 mins before your flight and you are new to this airport prepare some extra energy to sprint! I arrived in AMS at 6am on a cold November Saturday morning on my way to Oslo using a connecting flight. The bad thing was my flight from KUL was supposed to arrive at 5.25 am and the plane to Oslo was to leave at 6.50 am. Fortunately the immigration line (though crowded) was quite efficient. But for the rest I had to sprint all my way through Holland Boulevard a seemingly endless strip stretching in the middle of the airport to reach the gate where my plane waited. For passengers make sure you arrive at least 2 hours before your flight to enjoy all Schiphol has to offer.

author: Martijn Wubbels
content: Long rows very inefficient. I arrived at 5.35 at the check-in for Lufthansa and the queue was terrible long. My flight left at 07.05. Turned out they had just 2 kiosks open for around 4 different Lufthansa Flights. Finally they decided to open more check-in kiosks and the queue disappeared rapidly. It was already 06.20 when I could check-in. The lady was nice and when I told her I had a flight at 7.00 she advised me to tell it to the ground security as there were ridiculous long queues for the luggage check. I was directed to the premium users queue and although it took a while arrived at the gate at exactly 6.35. What is disappointing for me is that a great airport as Schiphol has this kind of problems. There must be something wrong there. It is a very nice airport but they really should invest in order to make check-in much smoother.

author: C Wajsberg
content: Large airport where everything but baggage delivery seems to be working very fine. Check in was flawless albeit I do have a platinum sky team card so no long lines. Passport control very friendly and professional duty free anything you can imagine but very expensive. KLM lounge is nice but not enough cleaning staff to keep the place clean of empty glasses and used dishes. Long walks to gates as there are many but everything is clearly marked so you do not get lost. All be it very well organized airport.

author: Lalchhanhima Ralte
content: Flew in to Schiphol from Montreal by KLM on 20th Oct 2012. Read a lot of negative reviews but I must say it is a wonderful airport for transit. Yes it may not be as big as Changhi or Dubai but nevertheless not a bad place for a short transit. Love the free WiFi.

author: M Calame
content: LUX-AMS-SIN - SIN-AMS-LUX - The airport is very functional and the area of Tax free shops and restaurants are numerous. It was clean and it was easy to find its way. What a pity I had a short time for the connection. On the whole I've really appreciated the infrastructures shops and signals. My bad experience concern the security check. The staff was quite unclear regarding the electronic appliances to show and I had to re-pass the check of my cabin luggage and without any pressure from ourselves we could still wait. I've nearly missed my connection due to security check. Anyway I hope to come back to Amsterdam for a connecting flight. Really good airport.

author: A Stephens
content: Insufficient time to catch connecting flights due to ridiculously long queues in passport control. Lack of special channel for European Union Residents existing in other airports. Flippant and inefficient attitude of passport controllers who appeared to be young and shallow. Numerous anxious passengers waiting in the queues who were ignored by the ground staff overlooking the queues. Security baggage checkers slow rude and careless with passenger's baggage literally throwing bags onto the floor to be rechecked. Many of them with a deficient level of English to facilitate the process. Surprising in Holland where most people have a good command of English! Enormous distance to reach connecting flight gate. I was heading to gate D87 at full speed when gate D56 was announced for my flight. I took no notice and a couple of minutes later they corrected themselves and said D87. Without doubt my last visit to this nightmare airport!

author: H Drubbel
content: Combined with internet check in and the KLM app for Android it works great. Luggage drop off is fast and easy waiting time at customs can take a while but in general it takes 5 minutes to pass. Enough to do to pass time like a museum many shops and even a casino. Facilities are clean staff is friendly and finding your way around is easy. Food and drinks are like any airport priced upscale.

author: D Macleod
content: There are so many good things about this airport that make it my favourite to travel through on and off for the last thirty years almost. It may be big but it is never a real chore to walk from one point to another and in many trips through the airport I have perhaps fortunately not found myself seriously having to race from one flight to another. The shops the bars and restaurants are generally of a very high standard as are the lounges and staff are generally very pleasant. I have but one criticism and that is security for flights to the UK. On my outward journey last week security check for the leg to Helsinki was fair and thorough but just a common ordinary security check; on the return journey from Amsterdam to Aberdeen the security was oppressive and obtrusive. Some staff were thoroughly unpleasant process was slow and perhaps amusingly and reassuringly the captain was forced to go through the scanner three times before he was allowed to board the flight. Nevertheless I find it strange that flights to the UK should be so much more thoroughly checked than others. Are we a greater risk or at greater risk or is this just a reaction to our not being members of the common border agreement in the EU? For all that I would still say Schipol is my favourite airport of the majors in Europe. I have noticed this disparity of treatment several times in the last few years.

author: Michael Sewell
content: A very efficient if incredibly large airport. Lots of toilets shops cafes and plenty of opportunities to watch planes take-off and land. The cafes are a little over-priced which is a great shame. Yes you have to walk a lot here but if you allow extra time it's a pleasure to use.

author: S Norton
content: On the whole I like Schiphol the signage to the BA check-in is non existent - I nearly always struggle to find them and I travel through several times a year. BA Lounge is small but tranquil the staff are always welcoming. It is a long walk from check-in and the walk to the gates is usually quite long as well. In some ways I prefer the gates that are the furthest as they have a mini 'central security' which means that premium passengers can have priority boarding. Most of the gates have individual security which means queuing up at the gate for security and again to board the plane. It seems an inefficient use of manpower. As I usually only stay in the Netherlands for a short time I avoid checking in baggage - the wait for bags to arrive is lengthy. The only other complaint is the taxi to the gate when arriving it can be in excess of 15 minutes. In summary not the worst used to be one of the best - but definitely needs more than a band-aid to put it in my favourites again.

author: D Kennerley
content: Over the years used Schipol a lot but had a long break the past 10+ years. Facilities that a new since my last trip much appreciated - and used - Ryjksmuseum and library. Toilets were clean and fully stocked. Long distances as most people mention but with 5.5 hours hold over not a problem. Very poor boarding arrangements with long queue and slow process. Appreciate need for proper vigilance and doing a thorough job but something needs to be done to speed up the process - more checking devices/staff? Flight delayed all down to slow procedure. I was near to last in the queue and so far as I can tell no passengers were late. Could see staff beginning to panic as time went on. One issue I have is with Airport personnel zooming around on electric vehicles. They drive at breakneck speeds relative to the fact that the airport is always fairly congested with passengers.

author: David Tjan
content: I made more then twenty flights this year mostly from Schiphol. This September I departed from Schiphol four times. 3 times Schengen lounge and 1 time intercontinental. I have to say that Schiphol is becoming more and more outdated and is rapidly losing ground with major Asian competitors like HKG SIN and Seoul Incheon and Munich and Madrid in Europe. It's overcrowded congested not passenger friendly and the terminal buildings are getting old and claustrophobic. During peak times going through security on the Schengen side is like standing in line in Disney world with endless waiting cues. One time it took me over 40 minutes to pass security. For the first time I noticed how dirty it became especially the dining area above the Schengen departure hall. All tables were full of dirty plates left behind for several hours without cleaning. Food choice was also very poor. The staff tends to be arrogant and non service minded. I am also surprised how uninviting the immigration area is. A small dark corner when entering the Netherlands. Baggage claim is terrible small long wait and sometimes I feel as If I'm on a marketplace with no space at all to move. Usual wait lasts more then 30 minutes for baggage to unload and counting. I wish I could be more positive but I do think Schiphol needs a major upgrading to maintain it position as a big player in Europe.

author: D Macleod
content: I come through Schiphol probably four times a year for the last twenty years or so and still say it is my favourite airport. It is a sizeable airport and consequently we have to walk distances but I have never found a problem with signs or with time available. There can be long queues at passport control and at security at times but I have always found the staff friendly and welcoming. Yesterday incidentally transferring from a flight from the UK to a flight to Finland I was through passport check and security in less than five minutes; not always so I know but the staff have always made the transfer relatively easy as far as I am concerned. I also love the opportunity to use the excellent Dutch bars and the attractive shops; probably the only airport I use where I really take an interest in the retail opportunities.

author: P Dalloz
content: Clean and good facilities but badly managed security. Cant take drinks (even duty free) in hand luggage. Long queues waiting in the tunnel to get off the plane. Officious security people and intrusive body scanners.

author: Azlan Hashim
content: I arrived from Kuala Lumpur on transit for my flight to Helsinki on the 7th of September. For some reasons I had to collect my luggage and recheck-in at AMS. There were huge queue on both at the check-in and passport control area. A long walk at this airport is very common. Eventually it was almost an hour from the beginning of my check-in time to the departure gate. My suggestion to those are going to use AMS for their start or transit point have yourself present at least 2 hours at the airport before your departure time. On my departure back to Kuala Lumpur on the 14th of September I was surprised when there was almost no queue at the check-in counter. Especially the designated counter for web check-in service. The agent was friendly. As usual there was a long queue at the passport control and a long walk to the departure gate. In general the airport is clean. The food chains and toilets are plentiful. 2 or 3 hours of free wifi is a regular practise in most of the airports worldwide. I hope AMS would apply that in the future and I bet passengers will happy and appreciate it!

author: J Andrews
content: Three hour transfer at Schipol. Lot's of seats food outlets and toilets all very clean. Long walk between gates but was OK as I had plenty of time. Lots of shops for those who like that kind of thing. Museum was a fun way of killing time. Security at gates was quick and efficient but many passengers ignorant of security at the gates and wandered up for their flights very late causing delays (read the boarding pass for goodness sake). All the airport staff I encountered very friendly and all spoke English.

author: A Sandhu
content: DEL-AMS-IAD. We had a 6 hour layover on the return flight airport was good with easy to access facilities but a long walk to the gate lots of stores and shopping and many things to do to pass time such as taking a tour of the city which you can schedule at the airport.

author: Alan Finch
content: Usual efficient experience in Schipol large distances to walk but as travelling to Canada no need for Schengen. Only disappointment - can only access roof terrace from departure hall otherwise trouble free.

author: C Neville
content: Very good airport friendly staff - who even have a sense of humour! Easy to get around excellent connections to UK and elsewhere good facilities and very nice Business lounge.

author: Alastair Finch
content: 2 long layovers at Schipol recently can stretch ones legs walking the long distance from one end to the other. Facilities excellent only downside is one can only access the roof from the arrivals hall. However it remains one of my favourite airports.

author: A Van de Wiel
content: I always enjoy Schiphol airport. It is clean has good facilities and great shopping. There is even a library. The distances between gates are sometimes quite long but everything is easily reached. Luggage handling is excellent there is a fully automatic luggage drop off and a passport scanner so you do not have to stand in line anymore. Even at the busy holiday season these processes are quick and efficient.

author: J Cioboata
content: Great and efficient airport. Facilities at the airport are excellent I especially enjoyed the annex of the Rijksmuseum which had very interesting paintings on display. Numerous shops to browse and plenty of eateries. One thing I missed was a proper sit-down service like. Signage and layout is easy to navigate however distances can be long but on a positive note it at least allows for healthy exercise between flights. One thing I really appreciated was that the security check is done at the gate which makes it less stressful and prevents endless queues as seen at airports with a central security check however reviewers seem to have a different opinion about it.

author: Pat Theo
content: We flew in and out of Amsterdam. I don't mind walking a bit but this is a large airport and it was a bit much especially if you are short of time. Full body pat down I moaned to the woman doing it and she was sympathetic and said how much she hated Amsterdam it was too busy and dirty for her! As for transferring nothing would induce me to go via this airport to anywhere even if it is the cheap option! The loos we used weren't very clean and needed maintenance. Food options looked good but we didn't have time to get more than a sandwich. We have friends arriving there today (and coming on to the UK) en route from Detroit I just hope they don't have much hassle their flight was already put back 5 hours so will have missed their connecting flight and we will have more hours to wait and a full body pat down might be the last straw! I suppose being able to look at some exhibits from the Riksmuseum whilst they are waiting might compensate a little.

author: G Cramer
content: I frequently use Schiphol Airport. The terminal is clearly labelled. The facilities are clean the stores are interesting. Food service is varied and also good. Parking and transportation is very well organized. It's an excellent airport except for one big thing: passport control. It is completely unacceptable to routinely wait between 30 minutes and an hour just to show your passport (mind you this does not include going through scanners and such it's merely showing your passport). The lines are typically enormous hundreds of people squashed into one area. Usually there are several booths unoccupied even though the lines are enormous. Despite all it's many great qualities Schiphol needs to serve people better at passport control. Below it asks me if I would recommend the airport. Of course what other choice does one have in The Netherlands.

author: Farouk Mogheth
content: Flew through AMS on my flight from Prague to Cairo and return. The Airport is easy to navigate through loads of venues to eat and relax in the walking distances can get a tad too long if you connect from the EU to non EU terminals. Self transfer counters are great still with some nice staff assisting. SKY Priority works well in all parts of the airport. Unfortunately the self-passport control gates were not working so the lines were long even in the EU zone passport holders. Each passport and ID were closely controlled by the officers under magnifying glasses. The remainder is a breeze a very nice airport to fly through no complains at all except the "charged" internet.

author: N de Goffau
content: I fly often through this airport and for me I consider this as one of the most convenient airports. Plenty of facilities are available and the intelligent lay-out provides the advantage that no bus transport between terminals is needed what is unique for an airport of this size. Also every plane has its own gate what allows you direct walking access to the terminals. Handling of luggage is usually quickly finished and the transition below the airport makes that you can be very quick in Amsterdam. In summer times queuing might take a while but on average I have seen it much worse. Prices for food are relatively high. About transfers I cannot judge.

author: J Ludewig
content: I find this airport well organized for transferring flights. Less hassle than CDG for sure. Calculate some walking time but overall it works pretty good using AMS to change flights. I have been doing this quite a few times and it always was no problem.

author: Brian Hunter
content: I traveled through Schiphol Airport twice in June 2012. Since I was there in 2009 they have made Schiphol the most invasive airport from a security imaginable. Not only is a full body scan required but now all passengers (except children) are then subjected to a manual pat down. Are these multi-million Euro full scan machines less effective than the previous scanners requiring an additional fondling of passengers? I noticed that that the children are not placed in full body scanners but rather are walked though the old type scanner and after that are not subject to pat down. No doubt the scanner manufacturers have made billions of Euros selling machines that apparently have made the process more invasive and less effective. I will avoid this airport in future as this "new" technology makes the already ridiculous airport security process completely unacceptable.

author: P Merriett
content: The airport is too large if you are transferring flights and are on a short time line. The restrooms are unkempt dirty and smell horrible. The security is inept and ridiculous they made me damage my own clothing in order to move through the security check point. The staff in the airport seem highly offended if you are just transferring planes in their country instead of staying. My family and I will be avoiding this airport from here on out. Highly unprofessional rude and unacceptable.

author: L Dilling
content: Transit in AMS. Non-Schengen to Schengen return. Arrival time was 3pm and we found the Airport surprisingly empty. I am an EU-Passport holder my Partner is Mexican and I had no issues passing with her through the much shorter EU Passport holder line at immigration. Security check took 15 minutes. Distances at AMS are quite long we had 2 hours for transit which gave some time to stroll around the shopping mile. From all airports we visited on this trip AMS has the best Duty Free offers. On the return to Mexico we arrived in AMS in the Morning around 11 and the Airport was packed. Lines were long at immigration but we could again use the EU Passport line which reduced waiting to 15 minutes. Security check done at the gate which saved time. Staff friendly and efficient. Big Airport long distances AMS is stress free if your transit is 1 hour or less it might get stressful at peak hours.

author: L Scott
content: I have transferred through Schiphol numerous times easily and this time was no different. The simple gate numbering system and one terminal concept meant I could rush though with ease and still go to the duty free shop with only a very short transfer time and Information staff are very helpful. Because of this when I book flights I only ever transfer through Schiphol (with KLM) and avoid going through Paris CDG (with Air France) at all costs.

author: D Marshall
content: Used for flight transfer both ways. Toilets overflowing in both cases. System confusing. Worst of all was the security staff at gate D6 - very unprofessional and blunt to the point of rudeness. Very much a cattle market. I sympathise with some airlines who try to provide a good service but are let down by airport service providers in terms of the overall flying experience for customers. The airlines have enough collective influence to get things changed why don't they?

author: Brian E Smith
content: A completely functional airport but not as good as expected. It seems very institutional with lots of stainless steel and many areas were crowded (check-in and at the gates). I found it difficult to transfer between a domestic European flight and an intercontinental one as the terminals were at opposite ends. Toilets are clean! Good food and shopping opportunities. Getting into the city is easy if you're going to Amsterdam. The security is fierce! The first time I've experienced a full body pat down.

author: J Glazebrook
content: We will never travel through Schipol again. We had a long layover and could find nowhere to relax let alone snooze. Gates have fewer than half the number of seats needed for a flight and passengers line up like cattle in metal railing-defined queues. Security scanning is done at the gate. Process of checking in poorly handled by grouchy staff. The bathroom I was able to find near our gate was not very clean or private.

author: Bryan Clark
content: First time in Schiphol for 20 years and it is the easiest and user friendly of major airports. KLM ground staff and immigration made our transfer a pleasure despite time being against us.

author: Jens Jensen
content: Were very close on time arrived 10 minutes before check-in closed but still able to check-in just before check-in closed. Shuttle busses all the time which take around 10 minutes to Terminal 3. Passport control very easy and just after check-in. You can avoid the shops and walk straight to gates. Very easy to find with wide walkways and loads of rolling bands. Security check into waiting room was not so pleasant 5 minutes waiting time but the security guys were rude. On the way home passport control was very smooth but there was a long wait for our baggage.

author: P Vandenbroeck
content: Antwerp-Bangkok via Amsterdam with KLM. Arriving at the airport was a mess airport staff very rude and unhelpful. We had to queue for 2 hours at check-in. We were then brought to another check in were they told us we had 5 minutes to get to the gate. We ran to the gate and just made it (last passengers to board). To top it all off the plane didn't move for another 45 minutes! Horrible experience will avoid using Schiphol.

author: J Poultney
content: If you have a short transit time please avoid this airport. It is very large and there is a lot of walking to do between gates. The worst are the KLM staff who can be extremely unfriendly rude and dismissive when you need their help. Never fly into this airport when there is any delay in Amsterdam due to bad weather or any other unforeseen circumstances because staff can't cope. You will be left stranded for hours or days and they won't bother to help you find hotel accommodation.

author: Angelo Tzarevski
content: JNB-AMS-ORD return. Transferred at Schiphol both ways. This is a very clean and well organised airport. Gates are easy to find with maps and signs everywhere which are easy to understand and follow. There are a number of rest areas with very comfortable seating (especially the ones on the top floor of Terminal 3). They are very quiet and comfortable. The airport also offers shower facilities although I am not sure if there are any free ones. I used the facilities at the Mercure Hotel in the transit area which cost 15 euros but if you are transferring between two long flights the price is worth it. Staff are friendly and helpful. There are decent duty free shops albeit not many. Schiphol is an absolute pleasure to transfer through.

author: S Triantafyllou
content: Overall the best airport when it comes to duty free smoking lounges cafes etc. The worst when it comes to immigration staff - expect a 40 min-1 hr wait if travelling outside Europe. Recommended if your layover is long!

author: J Bergers
content: Overall it looks clean. The duty free shops are overpriced. Their system can be confusing mixing up arrival and departures. The biggest problem however is the security staff and police. Not friendly and at times arrogant or short tempered. Security is not well organized. In a short transit I would skip this airport. Travelling in Europe there are better options. Due to the very unfriendly atmosphere I would rate this airport poor.

author: J Martin
content: In every other airport we have been in the departure lounge comes after the security checks on people and hand luggage. Therefore at Schiphol we threw away our water and left-over drinks before proceeding into the departure lounge thinking the next step would be the X-ray machines. However the main security checks in this airport are just as you are called to the gate before getting on the plane. Wish we had known. We didn't have a delay but if you do it's nice to know that you are able to keep your own drinks until just before getting on the plane. This does save paying extortionate prices in the departure lounge. Why don't more airports do this? We can recommend Schiphol airport.

author: A Lepik
content: Clean and spacious (during the odd hours) toilet facilities are good. Signage is quite good sometimes a bit confusing. Immigration is fairly speedy but can be rude and arrogant depending on the officer. Airport staff is dismissive and has a definite attitude problem. Drink and food prices are extortionate many vending machines are not working. Too few resting areas for the amount of passengers during peak hours there are no places to sit. Getting around can be difficult as the trolleys cannot be taken to lower floors freely.

author: Martin Walker
content: What a great airport. Staff are helpful and kind it's clean the signage is perfect. Transportation into and out of the airport by train is very easy. They have even got smokers lounges. Recognising reality is a lost trait these days. Clearly Schipol has it's thinking head on. All airports should be like this.

author: Yevheniy Kahanovych
content: My last experience at AMS was 40 minute transit. Having had boarding pass issued at departure point for the whole connection with no AMS gate number I was trying to find gate number on monitors at the arrival gate - but no monitors! Luckily there was a pool of KLM self service machines where I printed new boarding pass that showed my gate number (the most remote D28). I went there to be searched at the gate and just made my connection. No issues with security staff (polite efficient and competent) no issues with KLM gate staff (nice and were able to track my baggage immediately). No issues with toilets (clean well kept) easy signage lots of KLM self service kiosks. But please put some more monitors at the arrival gate areas!

author: M Stav
content: I have flown through Amsterdam more than 20 times. A big airport with a lot of walking to be done. Its clean and bathroom facilities are frequent. The central area is full of shops and bars generally overpriced as a beer will run you 6-8 euros. All in all okay however staff and security procedures could be considered intimidating. Most times you go through a security check twice you get questioned one on one about your baggage and your entire day. The only thing I cant understand is their policy with duty free. If you bring a sealed bottled in the duty free vacuum sealed bag with a receipt from another airport they will confiscate it. Originally I thought this was a one time thing but over the years I have lost 3-4 bottles in that airport. I have been to over 100 airports and this is the only airport where this is apparently policy. Besides the duty free stance the high prices and the over the top security procedures I can't complain.

author: P Slumders
content: The airport has a lot of facilities plenty of room a nice atmosphere and efficient layout. Sometimes you have the problem with a short transit to have to run from one side of the airport on the other side.

author: Y Tabib
content: Airport Plaza is great better shopping options expected post check-in. Checking in can be crazy with long queues expect to do everything yourself self service check-in and baggage drop. Need more baggage drop machines and courteous staff.

author: Newt Paulson
content: I stopped in this airport for a couple of hours on my return from Italy to the USA since Amsterdam is a hub for Delta Airlines and for some reason I did not have a direct flight back to the states on my return. First we had to stand in a line for passport control to go from one terminal to another. If my flight were in the same terminal I would have just gotten on the plane but as it was not I had to go and have my passport stamped to enter a terminal - surely the workers realize the people going to the other side of the terminal are leaving Amsterdam and this was a waste of time. Then there was a huge line as they do security at the gate however the line was huge and there are not enough seats at the gate. I walked across the hall and sat for 30+ minutes until the line died down and then went through security. It seemed to me if you went through the line early not only would you be waiting in this huge line but then you would be in this "holding area" until you boarded the plane with no restroom.
