content: Chronic organisation when two planes arrived: it took almost an hour to get through passport control. On return the famous Gallic shrug came to the fore with no-one seemingly interested or caring about chaos and delays. Police attitude was unbelievable with their insistence of accompanying people visiting the toilets. The joy of flying into German and British airports!

author: Brian Murphy
content: Recently flew to and from Roissy CDG to Biarritz International in the Basque country in south west France for the first time. The airport itself is small but there is a good bus service which will take you into the city centre pretty quickly. On arrival on the 13.00 HRS AF 7638 flight from CDG this flight seemed to coincide with a number of other flights from the UK which made the baggage arrivals area chaotic. In addition the toilet facilities landside need some upgrading and definitely could do with the cleaners visiting there on a more frequent basis especially mid-afternoon which seems to be the peak time for the airport. The rubbish bin in the gents toilet was overflowing when I was there which left a poor initial impression! The airport does have an excellent tourism booth with very helpful staff however. In addition from the airport one can get onto the nearby motorway very quickly and the care hire agencies also had very helpful staff at the airport (especially Europcar). On departing Biarritz back to Paris however I discovered that the departures area has only one very small cafe so passengers may not want to enter this area too quickly as the wait could be long and somewhat boring. In summary the airport is convenient but it falls well short of the new fresher and modern design of nearby Pau airport which is excellent.

author: S Parkin
content: What a contrast to arrive from the chaos of Stansted. Plane lands bags come off quickly passport line 5-10 mins maximum. Taxis right outside airport arrivals (or bus stop turn right and go to the end of the concourse). My record for checking in at the hotel is 42 mins from the wheels touching the runway. Coming back on Easy Jet last flight out of the night so it's a bit quiet but again you get through quickly. Grab a beer. Don't even bother queuing until you see the incoming plane land and reach the gate. Very relaxed place to fly in and out of.

author: Marc Guillemard
content: Flew to and from Bilbao. Arrival was quick plane unloaded by Gateway. The building looks nice and is clean. The bad surprise was that we had to wait more than 30 minutes to see the first bag on the belt at a time we were the only plane arriving! I find this unacceptable in big airports and even more in a small one! Departure went well 2 coffees / breakfast facilities everything on time. A pity we got stuck in a bus 20 minutes while the plane was at 3 minutes walk!

author: Anna Kleinzahler
content: Flew STN-BIO BIO-STN modern stylish terminal architecture some way outside Bilbao but perhaps the nearest bit of flat land to be found amongst all those hills. No problems on arrival speedy passport check and luggage quickly up on the belt. Same when leaving fact luggage drop and security control. Airport is clean staff friendly and helpful. Minor gripes: no free wi-fi no post office to buy stamps souvenir shop did not have any postcards food and drink air-side expensive lifts seem to have a mind of their own not enough seats on the ground-side. Bilbao well worth a visit even for a day but certainly a weekend.

author: C Goulding
content: I agree with some of the post - it is a unwelcoming airport. The seating is really uncomfortable and very few. Sometimes one has to wait quite a while and so need to be able to sit in comfort - these seats are just hard plastic benches. The snack bar is just that. A proper restaurant is sorely needed. Give me the old airport any day. Have not been there for six years but will be doing so in a month's time in the hope there has been some improvement.

author: Yevheniy Kahanovych
content: Fast and efficient and looks interesting. On arrival bag was on the belt 5 minutes after flight. On departure there was no line at all to drop bag off to go through security to board the plane. When I arrived from London they forgot to stamp my visa for Spain. On departure they fixed it and were polite and apologetic. Small airport clean and efficient.

author: Dario Castillo
content: Bilbao Airport has now a full fledged restaurant besides the bars. Traveling MAN-CDG-BIO often I found this airport by far the best experience of the three. At least it has not become a shopping centre with a runway attached to it.

author: Angela Cullum
content: I have travelled in through this airport and seen many friends come and go. What is all the fuss about? It's a great little airport the staff aren't rude and some do speak English. It's a brilliant airport compared to the huge horrors of Charles De Gaulle and Heathrow. Sometimes I think people just love to moan.

author: L Eames
content: Bilbao airport may be nice on the eye with its exciting-shaped exterior but the interior is dark gloomy and uninviting the seating is poor and uncomfortable the staff are rude apart from few exceptions the shops are risible in their offer. I was also puzzled by the fact that the staff at baggage control were very dismissive and rude when I asked if I needed to take my laptop out. In their non-English and sign-language (of course having a good part of customers and passengers as non Spanish does not make any difference) they told me almost laughing at me that I could send it through and why should I be so paranoid? Finally and I don't know if this has something to do with the carrier easyJet or the airport policy but I had my passport checked 4 times: first at the check in counter then by the easyJet ticket office (the only polite member of staff in the whole airport) then at the gate by an official and then few seconds later by the check in attendant. This after the flight was delayed by an hour and a half and the gate changed 3 times characteristically in completely different parts of the terminal. A really bad experience surprising from a city that has made lots of money from the tourists flocking in to see the guggenheim.

author: Duncan Watt
content: Although the exit from the baggage claim goes directly outside anyone waiting to pick somebody up doesn´t have to wait outside if they take the escalators up to the terminal there is a landing halfway up which leads to a passageway (indoors) which overlooks the baggage claim area so they can actually look down on the passengers waiting for their bags from one floor above - it can get crowded in that passageway.

author: Rolf Heelas
content: Was not very impressed designed for not for function but as a statement which to me looked inspired by the 70's. The airport is small and has a few shops cafe's but nowhere to get any kind of food more than a small roll. Strangest thing was walking out of customs exit out into the cold. However strangest thing was security lots of police hanging around however the person screening hand baggage was doing so while reading a newspaper.

author: Franco Iacovella
content: I found Bilbao Airport to be a small and pleasant one to get through. No LHR or FRA airport here with all its confusion and chaos. Surprisingly enough there was no subway to the downtown core yet a 10 minute bus ride to the city center is all it takes on bus 3247 for 1.15 Euro each o/w. Upon departing Bilbao - caught the airport bus back to the airport as they depart every 1/2hour from Termibus Bus Depot. Punctual upon arrival - a quick easy check-in at LH counter - great lighting in the airport and nice to have the cafe with a view of the planes and tarmac while sipping cafe con leche once you have passed the security. I would rate the airport 8 out of 10 for easy signage clarity in lighting very smooth operations.

author: Carlos Rodrigo
content: I disagree with the comments. For a brand new airport Bilbao is a poor one. That it is now being rebuilt - just three years after its construction - confirms my bad opinion about this poorly built airport. Calatrava´s buildings may look nice but are totally unfriendly

author: John Andrews
content: Bilbao Airport is very modern and looks great from the outside. I've heard it described as seagull inspired but to me as you approach from a distance it looks more concorde inspired. Car parking is very convenient and a short walk from the terminal. When I've arrived by coach in Bilbao to catch a flight however it's a bit of a drag as there's no direct airport bus from the coach station so you have to catch the underground to the square in Bilbao from which the airport bus departs. The airport bus is cheap though at 1.10 euros. Inside the terminal I find it's all concrete and a bit spartan and claustrophobic the darkened glass doesn't help. The cafe area is pretty small but looks out over the runway so you can watch the planes while sipping a coffee. Having the exit from the baggage reclaim area lead straight out to the outside concourse rather than into the terminal building is a bit unusual as it means that people waiting to meet arriving passengers must wait outside in the cold.

author: Lawrie Hall
content: Overall I'd give Bilbao airport the thumbs-up. I've only departed so I don't have experience of arriving. Get airside as soon as possible as the bar/cafe is OK - but go in and find a seat as from the outside it is most unwelcoming.

author: Krista Jones
content: Despite it's beautiful external design (representing a seagull) Bilbao airport is probably one of the most uncomfortable user unfriendly airports that I have ever visited. The seating area is scarce with hard concrete benches. The cafeteria is small and the tables are always piled with dirty plates and glasses. Another of my complaints is that when passengers arrive and leave the baggage hall they come straight outside. This means that people waiting to collect arriving passengers have to wait outside in the cold/rain not very welcoming to say the least!!

author: Daniel Mori
content: This regional size airport is a gem. Not only does it have great design but it is also very functional. Ground transportation exceeds expectations as you can get a bus to/from Bilbao center for just 1EUR. The ride is quick and painless. Taxis are also available in large numbers and are affordable. Check in procedures are expedite and the staff is accommodating: one time I arrived at the airport 15 minutes before my flight and the counter staff was kind enough to check me in - the plane I was travelling on hadn't arrived it was nearly empty and I had no luggage but still I have to praise the decency of the staff for checking me in despite my delay (something not to be taken for granted in other airports). Security check waiting times are usually OK although some delays may occur in peak hours Overall BIO is a very good facility.

author: Borja Diez
content: The airport designed by Santiago Calatrava it's modern easy to use and offer a great image of the Basque Country. You can expect all the services from a big airport concentrated in an state of the art building.

author: Eveline Lau
content: Travelled from HKG to FRA then to Billund for a business trip. A tiny airport with insufficient facilities. A serious lack of staff while they were not helpful at all already. Self check-in machines available but not enough assistance at all. Medium length queues but moving very slowly.

author: Christian Britten
content: Billund is an excellent airport with good facilities practical layout and friendly and efficient staff. My only gripe is the airport bus which is extortionate (DKK180 to Aarhus) and runs at often perplexing times that seem to have no correlation to when major flights are landing. I've travelled here every other month from various UK airports for about 2 years and sometimes have to wait up to 2 hours to get away. As the airport is far from where most foreign travellers want to be (unless they really like Lego) you often have little option but to wait for the bus or pay even more for a taxi.

author: Claus Nielsen
content: My favourite airport. Fast efficient and very pleasant. Easy to get to easy to navigate check-in and security is always fast and friendly and the lounge above Security is great. Extremely roomy and classy great for work or relaxation even offers open smoker's cabins that don't feel like a cage - and a chess game for those with plenty of time. Almost everywhere in the airport can you overlook the runway and the whole place is just modern roomy and open. The airport size is an advantage without doubt - the distances between parking check-in security lounge gate and flight are minimal so getting in and out is always a pleasure. Much better than Copenhagen in almost all aspects.

author: Janne Petersson
content: This is a fantastic airport. Short walking distances nice staff good easy-to-navigate easy-to-use layout a stress-free atmosphere nice cafés. I used Billund as a transit passenger on my way from Copenhagen to Berlin and my only minor remark is that the TRANSIT signs just pointed to a locked door. I had to walk back exit and go through security again. Never mind there was no queue and I doubt the locked door is standard procedure since the security folks got a little bit puzzled when they saw my Copenhagen-issued boarding pass. Don't hesitate to use this airport.

author: Hanne Eeg Jensen
content: Arrival: Nice short walking distance to baggage claim. Fast baggage delivery. Comfortable smokers lounge next to baggage claim. Relaxed atmosphere; but still very efficient operation. Car rental easy to find - so is the carpark for rented cars. Departure: Easy car return. Clean cheap airport hotel "fit for purpose". Several breakfast options in the check-in hall. Easy and friendly check-in. So is security check. I got a feeling that they had though about everything in this airport - and that maybe that is the reason why everything worked so efficiently the staff had energy to smile and the atmosphere is so relaxed.

author: J Morgan
content: Billund is a stellar airport now to put it simply. It appears that not too many travellers are aware of the magnificent services offered at this airport. When recently travelling through BLL en route to Paris I was amazed by the design and atmosphere. BLL is chockers with beautiful details such as great furniture and airy Danish design gimmicks. Check in for my Maersk Air / AF flight was a breeze staff was friendly and immaculately groomed and the time spent from check in until I was onboard the new 737 was very pleasant - there are great shops and cafés and a good view to the many planes which you reach via airbridges. Would almost say that BLL is even better than its big brother in Copenhagen.

author: Nick Wilcock
content: I travelled through BHX last week with Lufthansa - outbound to Frankfurt on 21 Jul and inbound late on 22 Jul. Easy parking and a 3 min wait for the bus, check-in was quick and as a Frequent Flyer I was granted access to the priority security line. Reasonably quick, then through the perfumery to queue up for a coffee. Some of the seats near the boarding area have now been relocated (why?) - and Vodafone signals are still poor inside the terminal. But we left on time, so no real issues. On arrival, the flight was late out of FRA. It always seems to take the ground handlers ages to sort out the jet pier here though, but at least it wasn't a bus this time. Long queues at passport control, but the e-passport machines actually worked OK. It took only 4 minutes from stepping off the aircraft to leaving the passport machines, whereas the week before it took 25 minutes at LHR T2! Luggage arrived within 10 min, not bad for BHX! Crowds hanging around at the exit were as annoying as ever, but I was soon on the bus. My car park estimate had been 23:45 and I was later than that, but obviously their system knew of the late flight and I was soon on my way home. Overall an entirely acceptable travel experience - if only LH operated more flights from here! Unlike at LHR, lounge access isn't available for Frequent Flyers in Economy, which is the only disadvantage of using BHX.

author: Arthur Jackson
content: It's so frustrating that our local airport seems to have gone from bad to worse. Arrivals have always been a nighmare at BHX but departures are now almost as bad. Arriving 2 hours before a flight now leave no time for eating drinking or browsing the shops such are the queues at check in and security, which even has a queue to join a queue! Once through we had hoped for breakfast but found big waiting times at the three eateries we tried. We queued for 15 minutes for a cup of tea at Burger King who seemed to have 3 members of staff trying cope with the "cooking" and serving. Boarding had started so just time to grab a sandwich from Boots, the only place which seemed to have its act together, plenty of staff and the tills ringing. Arrival was chaos. Once through immigration it was over a very long and boring hour before our carousel decided to kick into life and start to do its thing. I frequently read that the airport has big plans to add more routes and airlines. All I can say is best of luck to the passengers if this does happen as I dread to think of what it will be like if it's any busier. I'll be flying from elsewhere.

author: R Field
content: This is one of my least favourite airports and one I shall try to avoid in future. Problems lining up steps to aircraft. Bus to terminal from airport appearing to get lost. Lots of stairs while carrying heavy bags. Slowness of luggage appearing, then stopping, then eventually turning up on another conveyor belt. Lack of frequent enough buses to car parks, meaning it was quicker to walk. All in all, organised chaos.

author: Lindsay Doughty
content: I am writing to complain about the disgusting state of the smoking area outside of the Meridien Bar at Birmingham airport. I am a smoker and was extremely shocked at the dirtiness of the balcony, not just cigarettes but glasses, cups, and litter. The ashtrays were overflowing. I have added some images of the area taken on the 1st June 2015. I would like to quote Imperial Tobacco's announcement of the opening of this area. The UK’s leading tobacco company, Imperial Tobacco, is delighted to announce the opening of a state of the art airside smoking area at Birmingham Airport. Travellers can now enjoy their chosen tobacco product free from the wind and rain in a dedicated area, accessible from the airport’s new departure lounge bar. This purpose built and unique facility provides lighting, shelter, hand gel and litter solutions. There is also a departures board to ensure travellers can keep track of their flights. If you are going to open a smoking area, which is much appreciated, please do not treat travelers like third class citizens and expect them to smoke in such a dirty disgusting place. I have included the first photos of the Birmingham airport smoking area and the latter of a comparison with Bodrum airport outside smoking area within the departure lounge.

author: Glyn Cookson
content: I have used it hundreds of times over the years and it still seems to have a dated culture. Departing is usually not the problem but arriving and waiting for gates and sometimes steps or an air bridge is a joke, it often appears as if the plane has "dropped in" unexpectedly and taken them by surprise. Luggage collection is also a bit of a joke, can wait up to an hour for luggage to appear on carousel. It's worth noting that BHX is trying for more long haul flights now that the runway has been extended for larger aircraft, but heaven help arriving passengers if this come to be, it'll be a nightmare under the present system of baggage handling on arrival. It lags well behind the likes of Manchester Airport. The £1.00 charge for a 10 minute drop off is extortion at it's very best.

author: John Everill
content: I live just 3 miles from BHX however would rather travel 80 miles to Manchester airport for a much better experience and ultimately a much faster return to home after waiting to clear border control and even longer waiting for cases to be put on the luggage belt. I have travelled from and to this airport dozens of times yet always it takes an age to get cases onto the luggage belts. Border control staffing levels also leave a lot to be desired. I honestly believe that this airport is the worst in the UK and amongst the bottom section in the whole world! For the second city of the UK this airport is an embarrassment and a disgrace. It should remove the "international" from its title as it is totally misleading as this airport is no more than a local airstrip with no customer orientation at all!

author: Susan Salter
content: I travel on holiday from Birmingham Airport at least 4 times per year. When going through security/baggage screening on the last 3 occasions my cabin luggage has been selected for further investigation. I have had all my personal possessions removed and thoroughly examined one by one on each occasion. I quite understand this, my only concern is that other people who are waiting in line for their bags to be checked can stand and watch every personal item unloaded and examined from my bag (after all what else have they to do at the time?). As I always carry my jewellery in my hand luggage, I feel that my bag itself is at risk after the contents being exposed to the public. Would it not be possible to have some sort of screen that hides personal belongings which are being examined from other passengers?

author: James Jones
content: I travel frequently - about ten times per annum - to Jersey and back via BHX. I have noticed a gradual deterioration in the standard of ground handling for these flights at BHX. This dates from the change of terminals which now requires Jersey passengers having walked through the hideous perfume shops in the first terminal to walk a long way to the Jersey terminal where there is now only one inadequate junk food outlet apart from a small Boots and Smiths and a souvenir shop. BHX authorities have also removed most of the flight arrivals and departures boards including the most vital information board which is the one where you initially arrive in the terminal. One could be forgiven for thinking that the BHX authority has a prejudice against flights to Jersey and the other flights to UK destinations which leave from the same terminal and is determined to take it out on the passengers. However the main substance for my complaint is the truly awful level of ground handling for incoming Flybe Jersey/BHX flights which I have experienced in the last five flights I have made into BHX on this route. Invariably the aircraft is made to wait for its stand. Invariably there is a delay in getting the passengers off the aircraft. Invariably they are made to wait in the bus which takes them to the airside stairs to baggage reclaim. Yesterday for example there was a delay of 45 minutes from the time the aircraft on BE 502 stopped its engines before the passengers were able to retrieve their baggage and exit the customs area. 15 minutes in the aircraft before the doors were opened and the passengers loaded into a bus. A full 25 minutes waiting with locked doors in the bus before the passengers were allowed onto the airside stairs and another 5 minutes waiting in the covered walkway before we were allowed access to our luggage which had clearly been on the carousel for a long time. This is as I am sure everyone would agree totally unacceptable from a passenger point of view. It is also clear where the blame lies. Namely with the BHX ground handling organisation. Unless this is considerably improved I shall simply stop using BHX and I imagine so will many other potential UK destination customers. Yesterday was merely the worst of a long series if such delays in handling incoming flights from Jersey at BHX.

author: A Martin
content: Flew with Ryanair to/from Dublin. Has been a good few years since flying from Birmingham. Has improved but still nothing special. Queues for Security were good was through in around 10/15 minutes. Departure lounge is not great. Adequate choice of facilities low ceilings quite small and just a bit boring. Same has to be said about the Ryanair/Flybe pier. Arrival was pretty much the same. Flight was delayed until around 1am so the Terminal was pretty much closed so no queuing. Narrow corridors and not the most inviting of places. Only reason I'd consider BHX is because it's quite convenient and quite well served by public transport.

author: Keith Frost
content: No seats for customers downstairs. Rip off prices in food outlets and for everything else. Not enough Border Force staff for the number of arrivals or is it just bad management (one hour delay at my last arrival) like a third world country set up. We were herded and corralled and the staff thought this was an acceptable situation worst airport experience we've ever had.

author: R Martin
content: Worst airport in the UK. Every other UK airport has high service levels and quick processes. We have now been waiting 1 hour 15 minutes for our baggage and I would say half of the plane passengers are in the same position. Sort it out BHX.

author: D Bosworth
content: Landed at 21.15 on Sunday 22nd March 2015 from Sharm El Sheikh. Disembarked aircraft at 21.50. Reason for delay was that the wrong set of steps had been sent to the aircraft. Had to wait for replacement steps to be found. Not good enough Birmingham (especially if you have plans to expand). Why we weren't put on a jetty I don't know. Most of them were empty.

author: Arthur Jackson
content: It really puzzles me why how this airport can so consistently get departures right and yet consistently make arrivals such a nightmare. I've rarely queued for check in or security which is so much better these days. The departure lounge is reasonable with plenty of choice for a relatively small airport. What annoys without fail is their arrivals handling. Maybe it's because there is less opportunity for financial gain from arriving passengers (although their charges for baggage trolleys might suggest otherwise). I've never found immigration anything but busy that is on a good day. On a bad day the place is heaving with passengers queuing up the stairs to the gate concourse. Problems are caused when passengers use the lift to reach immigration leaving them with no option but to push into the queue. One might assume that after the time taken to clear immigration at least your bags would be merrily enjoying their carousel ride. Rarely is this the case. Why is this airport so slow at getting bags to belt? Sure every airport has occasional delays but Birmingham seems to have nothing but delays when it comes to the arrival experience. Odd as you'd think the airport would want the passengers last memory of the airport to be a good one obviously they don't otherwise they would resolve the issues. The airport seems to be hell bent on expanding but seem to be unable to cope with the arrivals they already have.

author: R Whitaker
content: Flew in last night (Feb 16th 2015) on Monarch ZB935 from Tenerife and had to wait over 45 minutes for bags to appear. Of the last ten times I have come through this airport only once have the bags arrived in a reasonable time and on a par with the many other airports I have used. I also find the mean mindedness of not having a free drop off area very irritating. In other ways the airport is pretty good but the baggage handling needs urgent attention. If it were not so close to home I would try other airports.

author: Gary Colburn
content: On a par with Manchester in fact slightly better. Queues minimal facilities more than acceptable Terminal one is spacious and easy to navigate. The free shuttle to the train station is splendid although there are no buses or trains that serve this airport from the city centre round the clock. A solid 9 out of 10 for me.

author: G C Nock
content: We arrived back into BHX at 18.15 Friday 2nd January on a Monarch flight we went through border control very quickly as there were a number of officers on duty. However the wait for our cases was pathetic the first case came onto the carousel at 19.05 we got our cases at 19.12 what a very poor effort from an Airport that is constantly hyping up itself about expansion and being an alternative to London. We live aprox. 17 miles from BHX and travel through there regularly. It's time they get a grip of what the travelling public want.

author: Nathan Mcilveen
content: Good airport and security was a breeze however my flight to Dublin was delayed because 2 Ryanair flights one from Ibiza and one from Lanzarote landed at the gate beside us and because the swing door was opened to the passport control area arriving and departing passengers from the Ryanair flight to Dublin were made to wait around half an hour packed into the airbridge like sardines and staff would not let the passengers into the airport until all the passengers from Spain cleared passport control so the ground staff could shift the door into the direction of domestic arrivals. If Birmingham airport are operating Common Travel Area flights they should have a dedicated arrivals hall for this purpose or at least some sort of partition separating domestic passengers from international passengers instead of a flimsy swing door.

author: G Beard
content: We travel regularly from this airport due to its proximity to home. The staff are consistently rude and unhelpful. It has fantastic transport links and ought to be the site for London's third airport but while it continues to provide some of the worst staff I have ever come across there is no chance. I am ashamed to be British when I see their treatment of passengers. Do the owners not wish to improve the place? Go and visit any other world airport and see what good service and helpful staff can do.

author: Keith Cooper
content: This airport can not handle the large number of passengers for Emirates and other busy flights and is a disgrace Thursday the 13th Nov it took us an hour just to walk up the ramp to reach the security desks. We just made it to the gate on time and there were still 40 passengers waiting to clear the security queue at the time of departure. The management if there is one need to visit Dubai to see a proper airport functioning. The duty free/food outlets at Birmingham are wasting their time being there at peak times as there is no time to use them Emirates should give up on this third rate airport.

author: T Flanagan
content: I travel from this airport a lot and it amazes me how moody and aggressive airport staff are and on arriving at there is always a longer than usual wait to vacate the plane a wait for stairs or buses to arrive and a massive wait for luggage. Its not a nice experience flying into or from Birmingham.

author: Steve Morton
content: Being a local living just 15 mins from this airport I am ashamed by the consistently shoddy customer service. Arriving back from Faro yesterday I watched the bags being taken off before we disembarked it was raining but the handlers did not bother to use the covers on the baggage trucks and just dumped bags on without any care whatsoever. It took fully 50 minutes for the first bags to arrive on the carousel and my bags was absolutely saturated when I unpacked at home most of the clothing inside was damp or wet. I also had a set of golf clubs that had to be collected from the oversize baggage carousel and these were also dripping with water although thankfully in a hard case. In the 'drop and go' car park there are no sheltered areas so you just get wet if its raining. My taxi driver was not impressed putting my dripping wet luggage into his car! Also why do charge £1 for luggage trolley? I've never been to any other airport that does this yet another way to make money from the customer!

author: C O'Hanlon
content: BHX-CDG-BHX. Another excellent experience of Birmingham Airport for this short hop to Paris. Checked in online and got dropped off at Birmingham Int'l railway station (to avoid the short stay parking charges) and was through security in about 20 minutes which included having my bag searched. Had a delicious lunch in one of the restaurants and still had time to have a browse around the many shops. Air France ground crew were efficient loading the plane and we were away on time. The return was even less eventful. Off the plane and through immigration within 10 minutes (using the automated passport gates). I didn't have any hold luggage so I was on the small train back to the railway station within 15 minutes of getting off the plane. A great airport which does everything I need it to.

author: R Lewis
content: Collection of baggage is far too long over 45 minutes to wait for the luggage to appear no good if you have an ongoing connection.

author: David Woodall
content: Worst airport in the country. Always have to wait for the stairs to get off the plane. They are never ready for the plane to land. Last time landed at 11.10 from Alicante still on the plane at 11.30 got off the plane and had to wait for 15 minutes until the buses finally left to take us to the Airport itself. Drove around for about 10 minutes in a circle to enter the airport about 30 yards from where the plane was before we got off it. Customs is a joke always add on 15 minutes for the Alton Towers style maze which leads you to a maximum of 3 customs officers and if you do decide to use the automated Passport recognition facility good luck!

author: D Earl
content: Living in Devon we thought we would try Birmingham instead of our usual departure airport Gatwick. Check in for our flight to Orlando was quick and stress free and was security. Enjoyable browsing in departures before our flight was called and boarded 15 minutes early. Regrettably not such a pleasant experience on the return leg. After landing we had a 20 minute wait for steps. 5 minute wait through immigration. but then a 40 minute wait for our luggage. After a long flight home the last thing you want are delays on the ground looking at other reviews this looks like a recurring problem that needs sorting out. Looks like back to Gatwick next year.

author: Justin Musgrove
content: Waiting 15 minutes to get off plane waiting half an hour to get through passport control currently been waiting over an hour for our bags from the carousel. This airport is a disgrace.

author: A Barrett
content: In the past 12 months we have flown from the airport twice. The queues both times have been horrendous. 18 Sept we arrived 2 hours before take off it took us that long to go through security passport control etc we only had time to grab a very horrible packet sandwich from Boots to take on the plane with us. We had planned on eating at one of the food outlets but there wasn't even time for us to visit the toilets before going to the gate! There was not time to buy anything (other than the sandwich) sit down catch our breath. It was very stressful and got our otherwise enjoyable holiday off to a very bad start. There was an express queue which costs £3 per person this is not the answer the queues for everyone need to be addressed. The automated gates would also not work and when I went to the only person I could see to help at the Express queue he told me I would have to wait as the £3 people take priority. This was very rude and so I told him it wasn't my fault the machines were not user friendly. We usually travel at least once a year from B'ham but we are seriously considering looking at East Mids or Manchester first now. Sorry please improve the experience for everyone.

author: H Reese
content: This airport really is let down by it's baggage handlers. For the second time in as many months I've waited and waited for bag with no information and no reasoning given. Yesterday Monarch flight from Rome arrived at 13.20. Got through passport control to baggage hall at 13.40 and signs directed us to belt 7. Nothing happened for 10 minutes. then the belt started. No bags came out for several minutes then 10 appeared. These ten went round and around with no one claiming them for another 10 minutes before another 8 bags came out. Over 100 people standing staring at the same 18 bags going around and around for 45 mins before the rest appeared. There was no information no one at the information counter. All of the bags were on the same flight. They all get unloaded on a big trailer. There can be no good reason for a handful to be delivered to the belt at a time. Either they are all there or they aren't. While this was happening 6 other flights all of which landed after ours received their luggage. The system does not work.

author: N Maybanks
content: Having used BHX as airport of choice for many business trips without hassle I was disappointed when landing on 1/9/14 that the airport was hugely understaffed from a baggage handling point of view (we were told just 3 staff for the whole terminal). To set the scene landed at 00.30 from Ibiza (Monarch flight 10 mins early) into baggage claim 00.45 (2 young children in tow) 2am still no baggage. We're told over PA that due to staff shortages we can wait an unknown period of time for our bag or it will be couriered to us within 7 days. Like I said earlier we have 2 young children it approx 2 am and our booked taxi is threatening to leave us for another booking. At this stage we left the airport thinking our luggage will be delivered in good faith as promised but no due to the baggage handling debacle BHX called the next day for us to return to the airport (45 mins each way) to collect our luggage. After many emails we begrudgingly collected our luggage along with an hours wait.

author: H Reese
content: For a small airport Birmingham is excellent. It has great transport links good facilities and check in and security has always been hassle free. Everything is easy to find and nothing is too far to walk to. What lets it down is the baggage handlers and ground staff. I travel through this airport a couple of times a year and every time have sat waiting on the plane for steps to arrive so we can get off or for buses to take us to the terminal. Baggage delivery is the worst I've ever experienced. The most recent flight we were waiting almost an hour after 3 bags came through and then nothing for over 45 minutes!

author: Mike Robinson
content: Arrived at the Air France check in after surprising my wife with a trip to Paris for our Pearl wedding anniversary. The good mood we were in soon evaporated after being confronted by the woman on the check in desk. The crime we had committed was not to use the self check system. The facial expressions she used were akin to someone chewing a wasp! With us both not being frequent fliers we thought we could go to her for help to say her demeanour was hostile was understatement  I explained that we hadn't used the system before to a surly reply of "there's always a first time". Well this is the first and last time I will be using Birmingham Airport.

author: R White
content: As a brum resident I regularly use this airport for short flights to the continent. Most recently was back in April for a short flight to Hanover. The airport really needs to work with the train operators to get 24 hour train services put on as for the number of early morning flights the public transport provision to the airport is very poor. There were no real glaring issues with check-in although whenever I've used the self check-in machines they have frustrated the hell out of me! They simply don't work and I've had to use the desks as a result to get my boarding pass. The departures process is not too bad compared to other airports. My only gripe with this airport is that it's departure lounge is a bit of a joke. Its a bit claustrophobic and cluttered. I wouldn't really want to be stuck here for more than 2 hours.

author: P Welsh
content: After a 2 hour delay by Flybe on Sat 31st May with no explanation we were delayed getting off the plane for another 20 mins and then to round it all off nicely we had an 3/4 hour delay for baggage with no information about what was happening and not a soul in sight to ask. Returning on 16th June again with Flybe there was a delay in booking in baggage and I found the personnel very brusque by the time I got through security I had to rush to the gate with no time to stop and browse if I'd wanted to. Birmingham airport really need to get their act together in future I will travel to East Midlands.

author: Shirley Norman
content: Arriving at 1.18pm on Friday 23rd May - 10min or more wait for steps to be brought to the aircraft for us to get off the plane then over 1 hour wait for baggage to arrive in the baggage hall. No information and no one around to ask what was going on It seems Menzies do not know what they are doing. Will think twice about using BHX in future unless they get their act together.

author: H Burden
content: Friday 23 May horrendous problems on baggage claim from Malaga. Carousel 6 was allegedly selected and when we got there the hall was heaving. Passengers on flights from Frankfurt Rome and Brussels were still waiting for their luggage to arrive and some ha already been there over an hour and a half. We then waited for an hour no officials could be found baggage reclaim desk had not been told of the problem and they had requested the attendance of managers from BHX and the handling agent but no one appeared. No announcements were made until eventually we were told by a member of staff that the. Malaga luggage was coming in on another carousel in a different part of the building. Some people had taxis waiting and had to pay huge extra costs but were being stonewalled when they asked for some form of compensation. The whole situation was unacceptable And badly handled. This is not the first time I have had problems with baggage handling issues at BHX and serious lack of communication.

author: George Barron
content: If you are flying to Corfu on a Friday morning with Thomson Airways arrive in plenty of time to do the check in. The problem we found was that the handling agent were unable to control the situation. At the same time to check in there is an Eastern Airways flight to New York and countless passengers were overweight in their baggage the Agent allowed these pax to unpack their cases at the check in desk to get down to the allowed limit. We saw many people taking clothes out and then wearing extra shirts jumpers jackets etc this took so long by these people in front of us. A complete failing by the Agent where the Supervisors and or Station Manager must have been sleeping. It wasn't funny to arrive in plenty time then experienced the situation to be the last two people to board our flight. You have been warned.

author: P Collins
content: Arrived back in Birmingham in the early hours of Sunday morning 11th April 2014 on a Thomson flight from Paphos. The walk from the aircraft to the airport custom control was horrendous such a long distance and as I have walking difficulties this added to the problem. I was not offered assistance or told of how long the walk was going to be which was very bad customer service. Surely when improvements to the airport are being made contingencies of walking stairways should have been considered.

author: John Dearing
content: There was an unacceptable delay in delivering baggage from flight to terminal at Birmingham Airport on Sunday 20th April 2014. Flight BE 9012 from Geneva landed at Birmingham at 14.05 having made up 20 minutes after a delay in Geneva but the baggage was not delivered to the baggage hall until 15.20 more than one hour after we disembarked from the aircraft. This was an absolutely unacceptable wait and certainly the longest I have endured in forty years of leisure and business flying around the world. Worringly the personnel at the baggage enquires desk were unable to explain the reasons for the delay and suggested that this was a common occurrence on Sundays. The sound quality of 2-3 messages delivered on the PA system in the hall was inadequate to gain any sense of their meaning. There was only limited seating available.

author: Giannicola Bonora
content: As nobody has recently updated BHX reviews I just want to say that the area of former Terminal 2 has been renewed at last. The disposed the old worn out and smelly carpets on the floor and on the walls and now there is a brand new wooden floor and anonymous but clean white wooden walls. The area still has minimal services compared to the main departures area but is less depressing than it was before and the dedicated duty-free area is adequate. Only one warning throughout the main departures area you are lured to go to "gates 1-9 for food and drinks" but once you are there (the former terminal 2 area) you only find a cafeteria with coffee and sweet pastries (excellent by the way). So if you are meant for a "serious" breakfast you are better off if you stop before going to your departure gate.

author: D Judge
content: I have just returned from my first air travel following a debilitating stroke and was very apprehensive on a number of levels I was very impressed and greatly relieved by the care and attention I received. The check in staff and the disability support team could not have done more for me when l first arrived at the airport and when we landed back in the UK. I would like to thank them all for a very positive experience which has given me the confidence to consider air travel again.

author: G Sparkes
content: Only had to drop our bags off at check in on 26th February at 10am with Thomas Cook going to Fuerteventura. Easy? That's what we thought. 4 senior citizens off on a winters break. First problem. Miserable check-in woman. Second problem we were allowed 15 kg each hold luggage and 5 kg each cabin luggage a total of 80 kg. We actually had 63 kg in total but the jobsworth at check in deemed that 3 cases had 1 kg too much and made us unpack a case and put 3 kg in to our one and only hand baggage. This made that case 2 kg overweight? This humiliation in front of a gigantic queue. We fly 3 times a year to the USA always from Manchester. Now I remember why we fly from Manchester and not Birmingham. Pleasant sensible efficient staff. I am Birmingham born and bred but I am ashamed of Birmingham Airport. Never again.

author: Stuart Ward
content: Flight out 24/2 07.10 back 26/2 17.45. Both ways fairly uneventful 7 minutes to get through security going out and coming back luggage arrived on the carousel after a 10 minute wait. So yes it was a good experience.

author: Tim Ricketts
content: We recently flew from BHX very early in the morning so everything went smoothly. However the return to BHX went very smoothly until we got to the baggage hall. Our flybe flight got into the airport 40 minutes earlier than expected. I fly all over the world and have never experienced such an inefficient crew of baggage handlers. We must have waited 50 minutes for the bags to come through. This is not the first time in fact it is every time I fly into BHX. Why do we have to put up with these baggage handlers. In Germany or other UK airports generally the bags are on the carousel when you enter the baggage hall. So why cannot BHX get there act together. I could fly into the MAN or EMA get my bags and drive the hour by the time BHX have the bags off the plane.

author: John Spencer
content: Easy to be trapped into paying way over the odds on the Drop Off Parking staff in the terminal quite off hand and don't seem to recognise that passengers actually provide employment for them. Won't use this airport in future.

author: G McLaughlin
content: Power cut at the check-in so I went inside to assist my wife who was travelling alone so I was parked in the drop off. Unfortunately I was charged £17 because I stayed more than half an hour but still within an hour (because of the power cut). Inside the Terminal staff very sharp and put up an aggressive front when there was absolutely no need. I agree they have to stand up for themselves when passengers become abusive but everybody was patient and understanding but the staff still very abrupt! I live locally but will fly from London if I'm going abroad. Check in staff don't have any pleasant manners about them either a standard that's certainly declined.

author: Raymond Gorman
content: I like Birmingham Airport as generally I have never had any problems when flying with any other airline but Ryanair. This time Jan 6th check in did not call through about my disabled wife and we had problems getting to our plane in fact we had been forgotten and we were the last one at a mad dash. Needs a moving stairway to planes urgently and I am absolutely disgusted with the £2 charge for trolleys. I have flown all round the world in my time and never had to charge for this service especially considering the price of the drinks and food in the airport may switch to East Midlands.

author: D Soni
content: I refuse to fly from Birmingham even though I live in the area Terrible airport from start to finish I think its extortionate when they charge for trolleys Parking in the drop off zone is horrendous and again nothing short of a rip off The duty free shops has be the worst in the UK staff haven't got a clue about customer service I recommend highly avoid whenever possible.

author: J Bowen
content: We were flying to Heraklion from Birmingham on Sunday 15th September upon arrival the check-in queue was horrendous it took us nearly an hour and a half to get to the check in desk and only then as we were pulled out of the queue because our flight was about to board. After and hour and a half drive to get there cannot believe it took the same amount of time to check-in. No time to get breakfast drink anything as the flight was boarding. Upon our return guess what it took over and hour from landing to get our luggage. What is the matter Birmingham a tiny airport in Crete turns it round in a quarter of the time. This is the second time now this has happened at Birmingham won't be going there again. They have all this fancy scanning at passport control and can't do a simple job like getting the luggage through. We had always chosen Birmingham over Bristol (when we live in Bristol) but not any more.

author: J Prior
content: Travelled through BHX to RHO on a Saturday recently. Check-in was efficient and polite. Had free fast-track security with lounge pass which was great as only 5 people in front of us. Lounge will be reviewed separately. What really annoys me is there do not seem to be enough airbridges so there is a trek down lots of stairs to get to aircraft. Added to that is the walking distance to some of the gates even younger passengers were out of breath. Why did BHX not install a moving walkway when building the International Pier. Same thing happened on return. Not connected to airbridge parked close to arrivals door but then long trek to passport control. Thankfully lots of stairs avoided by using lifts but again a moving walkway would have eased the problem. Same old problem with waiting time for baggage although 3 flights had arrived around the same time it still took 45 minutes for our bags to appear.

author: D Vernon
content: Security queues would be shorter if they weren't making up their own rules about what can be in hand luggage and pulling over people for items OK in every other airport I've been through in the US and Europe.

author: P Cairnduff
content: I was a bit gobsmacked when flying out on a Sunday afternoon when I saw the length of the security queue which stretched right round the perimeter of the landside departures area but extremely impressed by how well it was managed by cheerful and committed staff - only 25 minutes to get through - now that's efficiency at its best! The departure lounge is good in terms of the facilities it offers but I always hate the lack of windows in this part of the airport - it's amazing when you head out to the boarding gates the difference made by the light from outside coming in! Feel the UK arrivals terminal could be better staffed - passengers should not have to wait for doors to be opened but baggage claim is generally quick enough car hire pick up is a short walk from the terminal and the location means you can be on several major motorways in minutes - so all in all a pretty good airport.

author: Brian Steene
content: This is the last time I shall fly to Birmingham. I will use Heathrow from now on. There can be no excuse for the length of time it takes to receive baggage at this airport. Toilets are a disgrace. This is utterly unacceptable in this day and age. And to charge for trolleys is the final nail in the coffin.

author: Paul Drinkwater
content: Security at BHX probably the longest wait for security checks in the world has been like it for at least 18 months. Useless management always give excuses never try to rectify the major problem. Awful situation. they always say its a busy time of the day for flights! Get real its an airport what do you expect?

author: T Kenneth
content: The security queues are consistently some of the worse I have encountered but now this seems to have spread to check-in too. Flybe one of the biggest airlines in terms of routes from Birmingham have introduced a chaotic "self-luggage weighing" system. It's the airport equivalent of self-scan tills at supermarkets where they constantly tell you to seek assistance and there is no-one free to assist. When we finally got assistance we were told we could not use the system as we were travelling with an infant (wrong we had a child) and had to go to the back of the standard check-in queue! The check-in queue was full of people like us who had already checked in and just needed to drop bags but were no doubt unwilling or unable to take a chance on the self weighing option. Tempers were fraying all over as people weren't clear which queue to join.

author: D Jones
content: Credit where credit is due. I have often criticised this airport for the appalling queues for immigration and security checks and also luggage delivery waiting times. However I arrived there on a Friday in April and the passport control queue was fairly quick (Emirates landed after us) and I prepared for the long wait for luggage to appear. On this occasion the luggage appeared in about 10 minutes that must be a record for BHX. Perhaps they have taken on board the countless critical remarks and are now heading in the right direction.

author: Z H Myklebust
content: I recently arrived at BHX knowing that the baggage trolleys come at a price which I was not prepared to pay. I am a small person but somehow managed my 52 kgs of luggage on my own! The priority baggage handling of Business class was a huge bonus as I recall my baggage collection in Economy taking far too long last year. My cup of coffee at BHX departure cost me £2.50. I was very fortunate to get Express check in which greatly reduced the Security queuing time. I am unsure whether to recommend this airport in view of cost factors.

author: Sarah Bennett
content: Please make sure you are aware it costs £1 to just drop off passengers and for 25 minutes to pick up passengers is a staggering £7. Not impressed with the conditions of the toilets. Trolleys are £1 to use. Trolley staff rude and unhelpful. A rip off airport make sure you have a spare £20 just to walk out of the building! Final note bring food all food is over priced.

author: Jonathan Ryan
content: I have travelled through many airports around the world. While I accept that the management is focused on profit maximisation at the expense of customer satisfaction I do wonder why they are unable to get even the basics right - ie the toilets. The gents toilets are without doubt some of the dirtiest and smelliest airport facilities that I have encountered. (Only one airport in Africa (in Angola) and another in a certain Middle Eastern country compare with the BHX experience). Let us hope that the disillusioned management one day come to their senses as BHX does have the potential to be a proper international airport. For the moment though its management are very successful in portraying it as a regional second rate hub through which many people have no choice but to pass.

author: Richard Ormson
content: Over an hour to get through security on 8th April - that's enough to put me off ever using this airport again. Having only two security lanes open at peak time is completely ridiculous. There were plenty of staff around to manage the queue but if half of them had been put to running the scanners there wouldn't have been a queue that needed managing. If you ever do make it to the departure lounge there is a good range of shops and places to eat. They were almost completely empty when I got there (presumably everyone was spending so long waiting for security they then had to go straight to their planes).

author: Kevin Tunnicliffe
content: Returning to BHX on 19th January having been diverted to Glasgow the previous evening we were whisked through immigration having undergone this process at Glasgow the night before. Baggage was extremely slow coming off the belt the first pieces almost 50 minutes after disembarking the plane. Going through customs we were surprised and more than a little annoyed to see passengers stopped and made to produce passports and undergo scrutiny even though we had all cleared customs in Glasgow. Pretty disgusted at this abuse of power.

author: Kevin Tunnicliffe
content: Quick passage through security today which makes a nice change. Duty free boasting 40% sale but frankly the prices seemed no different.

author: John Lofthouse
content: I live in Birmingham and have used the airport on dozens of occasions and I have come to loathe it intensely to the point now where I happily travel 45 mins to East Midlands rather than 20 mins to Birmingham. I travel a lot around Europe and the occasional long haul and I can honestly say that Birmingham is one if not the worst airport I have ever had to suffer. The baggage handling is appalling the security staff are borderline rude and utterly obstructive and the worst of all is the endless queues through immigration on returning from any non-EU country. I am not exaggerating when I say I have never managed less than a 20 minute wait to get through immigration and it's particularly galling when each time only 5 desks out of the ten available are ever manned with a queue going way beyond even the endless snake.

author: J Prior
content: Used BHX during past 2 weeks and wish there was some continuity at security. Despite having used the same plastic bag for a number of recent flights it was suddenly too big. When I was given the smaller regulation one all I did was fold over top of mine and put it into smaller one. Thankful I wasn't sent back to machine to purchase the "proper" bags as queue through security was horrendous. Majority of security staff are very helpful. Baggage handling still poor waited over 40 minutes before first bag appeared and flight arrival info not cleared from baggage hall screens when it's obvious all the bags have been collected. If you've got 5-6 flights all arriving between 2300-2330 then it's sensible to have enough baggage handlers to cope.

author: Kevin Tunnicliffe
content: The experiences of departing and arriving at Birmingham were quite different. Departing was a bit of a nightmare. Even with fast track the queues were slow and security staff picky and pedantic. Belt shoes and so forth removed they seemed to be checking almost all hand luggage which slowed the security process down considerably. We were told this was so that this was so the process looked fair and they could not be accused of picking on certain profile groups and subjects. Snaking through the expensive "Duty Free" area is a pain as it prolongs the journey through to departures. On the other hand we landed about 40 minutes behind schedule but the e-gates were empty and we were through in seconds (lines for the traditional passport control were pretty full). Baggage on the carousel within a couple of minutes and we were on the road about 35 minutes after landing which is pretty good by any standards. My scoring is an average of the low score for departures and an excellent score for arrivals.

author: J Peart
content: Overall good experience. However having to pay for luggage trolleys and bags for holding liquids is just over the top. The route from security check funnels passengers through the middle of a duty free shop. In my opinion the airport owners are just trying their hardest to squeeze every last penny out of the users of the facility.

author: J Orme
content: I wish other travellers would just think about what they bring in to security! I travel thorough Birmingham every three weeks and I have to wait in Security because others have over sized liquids in their bags. Or the I follow the passenger through the metal detector who forgets to take their phone out of their pocket and says sorry! It is too late the queue has built up by then. I like the airport the service and the shops. It is passengers who cause most of the queues.

author: Chris O'Hanlon
content: Another easy departure and arrival at BHX. Got dropped at the railway station and there was no queue at check in. Only slight gripe is that even though BHX operates as one terminal the Flybe / Air France check in desks are still located in the Eurohub building which is separate from the rest of the check in facilities and involved a fair walk past the Arrivals area. On the plus side you can access the new security area from either side of the check in area and the queue from the old Eurohub building is definitely shorter. Departure lounge has a reasonable selection of High Street outlets and some decent restaurants. On arrival I was through immigration and at the railway station within 10 minutes of landing.

author: G Bunn
content: Last time I arrived the queue for passport control filled the hall and passengers were sent down in batches from the upper level. The escalator was turned off leaving only the stairs in use. It took almost one hour to get to the desk. BHX was a good airport but I wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy.

author: Linda Peplow
content: Worst airport in the world for seating before going through to departure. Not everyone can arrive just before check in and I don't see why I should have to constantly buy coffee just to sit. I didn't find any other seats before going through to departures.

author: Chris O'Hanlon
content: I always find BHX a breeze. Large check-in area and the new security area is much improved on the old one. Maybe I have been lucky with queues but I've never had to wait more than about 15 minutes to get through security. Once through there is a good choice of bars and shops and the new International Pier offers a great view of the apron with loads of seating. On return the new immigration booths assist with the queues particularly for UK passport holders and on my last two occasions I have been out of the airport within 20 minutes of landing. I agree with the comments on the charges for the drop off area so now I always get dropped off at Birmingham Int'l railway station which is free for 20 minutes and take the Maglev train to the terminal.

author: R Hale
content: BHX used to be a superb airport to fly to and from. Not any more. On the way out to Dalaman we were caught in a quite ridiculous queue for security which looped from the escalator right the way round the first floor shopping area and then along the passage way eventually and after a few more loops into the security area. So despite arriving 2 hours before departure we had limited time in the departure lounge before our flight was called. On return at about 23.25 a week later I was kept waiting about 45 minutes for our luggage. I then had an unpleasant walk in the rain to the far side of the long stay car park as the shuttle bus service becomes almost non-existent by late evening and is totally inadequate when several flights arrive at the same time. I then had to return to the drop off car park to pick up some luggage and passengers; I was there for a little over 10 minutes - enough to for the parking charge to click up from £1 to £2. BHX - if you are going to accept several flights together late in the evening - please retain enough staff to cope. A couple of years ago I would have been pleased to give a total satisfaction score of 9 or 10 for this airport.

author: R Waller
content: The airport is clearly focusing on short term financial performance at the expense of passenger experience. As has been mentioned elsewhere the cost of changing currency through Amex and the drop off charges are ridiculous and they even seem to have stopped picking up litter to save money.

author: William Cannon
content: Queuing times for security would be considerably decreased if passengers fully complied with the security procedure. Instead many passengers totally disregard the procedure and this results in their bag being pulled over for search. This not only delays them but also other passengers in the queue behind them.

author: J Prior
content: My boss travelled BHX-GLA-BHX 15/16 May. On his return to BHX it was 20 minutes before he left the aircraft and a further 35 minutes waiting for baggage. There was no-one to operate the airbridge then Menzies Handling employee had to get a code to open door into baggage hall. After 15 minutes standing at non-moving conveyor belt request was made for information on whereabouts of baggage. Eventually it started to appear after 35 minutes of waiting. Reason for delay was - we've had a lot of planes arriving. It's barely a month into the holiday season and already we have the familiar problem at Birmingham which seems to be their ability to cope with baggage delivery. My boss was not impressed!

author: Ian Arnold
content: 2 points to raise firstly BHX now uses American Express for bureau de change and I find them prohibitively expensive. Secondly on flights arriving late at night the airport authorities insist on using remote stands and bussing people to the main terminal which adds and extra half hour to getting out of the airport. This is the 4th time I have landed there late at night using different airlines and every time its a remote stand and a bus!

author: M Carter
content: Unfortunately I have to use Birmingham Airport to fly to the Channel Islands to visit my family. I nearly always find the security staff are the worst in the world. If possible I travel from Heathrow. On 12th April I had intended to be at the airport an hour before departure but due to late arrival of a train I only just made it 30 minutes before my flight was due to leave. I was told I should have been there 2 hours before departure - I have never had to for the Channel Islands and I have in my procession a print out saying 30 mins before departure. They emptied my bag all over the place then stuffed everything back in. An extremely nice lady helped me to calm down and I was offered a voucher for a drink onboard. Very bad security staff here and I am 70yrs old - horrible experience.

author: J Kirby
content: Travelling out from airport was ok although object to drop off parking charges made for such a short period of time (£1 for 10 mins) which isn't long enough. Makes it a very rushed start to any holiday. Return experience was even worse. Don't the staff check when flights are due in? We returned on a daily flight from Dubai but there were no trolleys at the pay station. There seems to be an air of indifference to the needs of the traveller and an unfortunate end to an otherwise wonderful holiday. Come on Birmingham stop being so money grabbing and start to think about your customer service. The two don't match!

author: Ann Salmon
content: Went to Lanzarote on the 1st April from Birmingham everything fine except for the security part which was a nightmare. Queues were huge. Two girls in front had a bottle of pop which obviously couldn't go through the first bloke told them it couldn't the woman on the x-ray machine said it could and then surprise surprise their belongings were rejected. The bloke at the end then proceeded to spend 10 minutes explaining that they couldn't take it through and then walked the entire length of the hall to tip it out and give them back the empty bottle! It took us 35 minutes to get through. The joke being that there is a sign as you queue telling everyone how much better the new security arrangements are.

author: David Sullivan
content: I've been a regular user of BHX for 20 years and unfortunately the last few have seen a marked deterioration in the experience. Security and border control are a particular problem. Margins are the main focus of management and if that drives away core customers (passengers and airlines) then it seems to be a question of so be it. Most other business airports I use regularly (LHR SVO IAH & AMS) have improved greatly in the last few years or at worst stayed the same. For me now the 40 minute time saving it offers me over LHR is becoming increasingly irrelevant.

author: A Mitchell
content: I've travelled from MAN LHR LGW and BHX and I find BHX better than the others. It's easier to get through security checking in is less stressful. LGW is horrific for getting baggage but BHX is always much quicker. I do agree with the astronomical drop off and pick up charges! £1 for 10 mins! Least LGW is free!

author: S Bullas
content: This is my nearest airport and unfortunately I am unimpressed. Birmingham leaves a lot to be desired despite the so called improvements. Its got rip off parking fees you have to pay for a luggage trolley and you don't get your money back. Coming through security you suddenly arrive in the midst of the 'duty free' shops. Why have they not included some mechanical walkways. Luggage takes quite a long time to come through on the carousels. One good thing about this airport is OCS who deal with passengers who need assistance they are brilliant and provide a wonderful service its a pity the same cant be said for the rest of the airport.

author: David Gartside
content: Used BHX in preference to MAN for a trip to Denmark. Efficient - minimal queuing either on outbound security or inbound immigration. Luggage delivered speedily. Shops everywhere but that's just how many modern airports are I'm afraid. Quiet spaces can be found just beyond the shopping area. A lot less stressful than MAN and much cleaner.

author: W Beech
content: Always the same ridiculous drop off and pickup charges it would not hurt having a couple of hours parking for a reasonable price. I might even use the airport cafe and spend a little more money on a coffee while I wait for the unexpectedly late plane. I may then not do everything I can to avoid this airport again.

author: S Casey
content: I arrived in the middle of the day and was able to use the scanner to get through immigration. No queue and I was done in less than 5 mins. Perfect after a long journey from Australia! The airport looked clean and of course one has to navigate through shiny duty-free shops just to get into the country but overall I found it much more pleasant than the busy Heathrow. Departure 4 weeks later was early (6 am) and the airport was getting busy when I arrived at 4.35am. However I got from passenger drop and through security in less than 30 minutes (having checked in online). Clearer signage would have saved me walking in a big circle to get to bag drop but when I got there it was quiet and the check-in agent was very friendly and helpful.

author: Stephen Jones
content: Arrived back from Dubai on time 6.45 Sun evening and had to wait 1 hr 20 mins before the luggage came through. Servisair did nothing until people started to complain at their desk after an hour. It didn't help that I counted 6 uniformed Servisair personnel in the concourse standing around looking bored including 4 staff whose only job seemed to be to stand next to the belt watching us and occasionally removing a piece of luggage from a previous flight. After a 7 hour flight lands on time how can luggage take another 80 mins? Birmingham Airport leaves a very bad impression on passengers who have to endure such dreadful standards of service.

author: D Bingham
content: Agree totally with previous posts regarding security travelled during mid term and it took 60 mins to clear security (3/10 desks open) while facilities are okay inside and prices are no more expensive than MAN/LBA/LGW I wouldn't use them again until they consider more appropriate staffing arrangements. If you are going to go fast track bear in mind this will only move you about 50% along the queue a queue you don't experience at MAN - the airport we will be going back to I am afraid.

author: M Boyd
content: Birmingham is ok as an airport generally but why is everyone not outraged by the fact that there is now an option to pay for express security clearance at departures which is being forced on busy people by the long delays caused by the new layout which other reviewers have mentioned. A cynic would suggest that the long queues are a deliberate ploy to make more money from this scheme. Either way this is a total exploitative rip-off akin to the credit card booking fees charged by airlines and other on-line operators. Sort out the security process to make it quicker and less onerous for all customers please!

author: Emily Jones
content: I did not think there was going to be a big queue at 4.30 in the morning yet there was. I thought Birmingham International were meant to have changed that yet I see no changes! On the other hand I thought the facilities offered at Birmingham were good plenty of places to eat plenty of shops with a good amount of toilets which is handy when you have young children. The internet was also very quick and handy.

author: J Prior
content: Travelled to Kos airport quiet for mid-morning. Everyone polite including security man who patiently searched hand luggage to locate scissors mistakenly packed. No long queues. Departure lounge is now one glorified shopping centre. Queues in WH Smith appalling whenever I travel from Birmingham 2 out of 5 tills open is just not good enough. Why have 2 shops with one dedicated to selling books only. Prices in "duty free" getting more expensive as we experienced in arrivals far better deals in supermarkets and on internet. Setting down/pick up time now reduced to 10 mins for £1 yet another money-making venture. Why does Birmingham Airport continue to bite the hand that feeds it? Baggage arrival slow but that's normal whatever time you arrive. Come on Birmingham get your act together you need to provide a better experience if you want to attract more airlines.

author: A Ward
content: I returned from Ibiza and had to wait 45mins for my luggage from belt 4. The only downside to this is always a long wait for luggage. I queried the wait at the Servisair desk and they didn't seem too concerned. As for all the other facilities I have no complaints.

author: I Arnold
content: Ryanair to Malaga return. Security check outbound was slow and took 45 mins to get through at 16.30 on a Sunday afternoon. On return immigration queues were awful and took exactly an hour to process through however at least baggage was on the belt. Food/drink prices are average airport prices now and terminal looks clean whenever I have passed through.

author: M Pillai
content: This airport is awful. When I arrived back from a holiday it was around 7.45pm and it took an hour of waiting before all my baggage could be collected. My biggest problem is that they charge you £1 for a trolley to carry heavy suitcases. Every other airport I've been to around the world do not charge to use trolleys even the tiniest airports in Malaysia don't. At evening times the airport is poorly staffed and service is horrendous. It's quite clear when you walk around that a lot of money has gone to waste on stupid gimmicks.

author: G Failey
content: Drop and Go charges as far as I am concerned as a fairly frequent visitor have been increased without much publicity resulting in a doubling of the minimum stay having been reduced from 15 to 10 mins. Even 15 mins is insufficient time to help people with disabilities elderly folk or unaccompanied young people resulting in making even a shortish stay an unwelcome expense. This adds no capital to the appreciation of an otherwise very good airport experience as a 'dropper-off' or as an air passenger.

author: Stuart Ward
content: Scheduled Monarch flight to Almeria. I've been using BHX for about 30 yrs mainly for holiday flights. Pre Booked car park meant a short walk to check in hall check in was relatively painless  I was worried about the security queues but we went through in about 10 mins (Thursday midday) even the security operator mentioned about how quiet it was. It's like Manchester now as you have to fight your way through duty free but on the other side there's plenty of seats and shops/restaurants. There's no announcements of flight departures but plenty of screens telling you of progress so no problem. Overall it did what it promised yes prices in restaurants are higher but show me an airport that doesn't.

author: Kuldeep Singh
content: This airport lacks basic amenities and the big one is the lack of water fountains. The authorities force you to buy expensive water plastic bottles. They also keep you in the shopping lounge for long time. Your gate is announced only 10 mins before the departure. The shopping lounge is crowded very loud with retailers playing loud music and the shops are extremely expensive.

author: Giannicola Bonora
content: I think the "one terminal" revamp has fairly improved the overall departure experience from BIA especially for those once using terminal 2. The look now after security is that of a big modern airport more similar to Manchester Airport after the last refurbishment. Only disappointment is when realizing that the gates area of terminal 2 has been just "connected" not improved in any way. It is still the small dark depressing round area filled with extremely dusty carpets that it used to be. Only now the contrast with the rest of the airport is more evident. Can't say much about the queues because I usually depart on Sunday afternoons when the outbound traffic doesn't look predominant. Finally I will always support this airport at least for the excellent connection with a main railway line.

author: T Dokland
content: Recent Improvements have made this small airport quite reasonable. There are a few dining and shopping options and the area is fairly large and pleasant. They still play terrible elevator music. Free internet is a bonus. The airport is conveniently located to the city but there is no public transportation available. Parking is $12/day bit it is often difficult to find a spot.

author: L Brown
content: The airport has been and still under going renovations. The issues with no food past security have been fixed. The wait times are typically very short. Security can become long on Monday mornings but typically it is very quick as well. Walking distances to and from gates as well as to and from parking/car rental are rather short. There are no 1-2 miles walks to gates or otherwise. The biggest issue with the airport is the quality of staff at food outlets but that is not much different at a lot of airports. Overall it is a very good midsize airport.

author: Kevin Tunnicliffe
